loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 42 years old and married with 3 children, all of whom attend school.  Denia has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years.  She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamin for her pigs.  She has borrowed from NWTF 22 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Denia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 44 years old and married with eight children, three of whom attend school.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Nilda is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Nilda has been raising pigs for three years.  She also earns additional income from selling firewood.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 56 years old and married with three children.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Marina has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines.  She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en:
Pisa is a 53-year-old married woman with 8 children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and cabbages to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 3 years.  Pisa has requested a loan to buy a bush knife, axe, file, chainsaw, chemicals, and fertilizer.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2009.  With her profits, Pisa hopes to save for her children's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a bush knife, axe, file, chainsaw, chemicals, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Meritiana

texts.en: Meritiana is a 20-year-old married woman with 1 child.  She would like to start growing taro, banana, yam, and tomatoes in order to earn a living.  Meritiana has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and wheelbarrow for her business.  She will spend her profits to support her family and to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Tagiilima

texts.en:
Tagiilima is 25 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business catching and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, spears, and a diving mask for her business. 

In the future, Tagiilima hopes to buy a modern boat for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, spears, and a diving mask.

loans.name: Mulauvao

texts.en:
Mulauvao is a 19-year-old young lady with no children.

Mulauvao would like to start growing taro, taamu (giant taro), yam, and bananas to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, and taro root.

Mulauvao will spend her profits to help support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, and taro root.

loans.name: Manufou

texts.en:
Manufou is a 56-year-old married woman with five children.
 
She would like to start growing taro and bananas in order to earn a living. Manufou  has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, gloves, fertilizer and taro root. 

She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2013 in order to gain access to financial services.  Manufou will spend her profits to support her family. 
"

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer ,bushknives, gloves, fertilizer and taro root.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children.  She would like to start growing taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living.  She has requested a loan to buy a bush knife, spade, chainsaw, file, and pickaxe.  Janet will spend her profits to improve her family’s standard of living.  She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain excess to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bush knife, spade, chainsaw, file, and pickaxe.

loans.name: Fiailoa

texts.en: Fiailoa is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children.  She runs a business selling canned food, freezer, soap, snacks, and others items in her community.  She has 3 years of experience with this business.  Fiailoa has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sacks of sugar, rice, onions, snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, crates of vailima beer, noodles, toilet rolls, and salt for her business.  She plans to use her profits to extend her business.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store.

loans.name: Apiseka

texts.en:
Apiseka is 29 years old and married with three children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu (giant taro), and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Apiseka needs a loan to buy chemicals, bushknives, wheelbarrow, pick, shovel, and fertilizer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Apiseka will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, wheelbarrow, pick, shovel, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Katalina

texts.en:
Katalina is 46-years-old and married with two children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for  two years.  Katalina needs a loan in order to buy a backpack sprayer, a chain saw, bushknives, a file, a rake and a wheelbarrow for her plantation.

She has been a member of Kiva partner SBPD since 2009. Katalina will use the profits from her sales to help her family meet their daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a chain saw, bushknives, a file, a rake and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Peau

texts.en:
Peau is 62-years-old and married with four children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years.  Peau needs a loan in order to buy a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, a taro root, a bushknives, a file and a pickaxe for her plantation.

She has been a member of Kiva partner SBPD since 2008.  Peau will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, taro root, bushknives, a file and pickaxe.

loans.name: Meripa

texts.en:
Meripa is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. 

She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages in order to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Meripa has requested a loan in order to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, fertilizer, a rake, a pick, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe,a shovel and vegetable seeds.

She has been a member of Kiva partner SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Meripa hopes to save more money for her children's education.
"

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer ,bushknives, fertilizer, a rake, a pick, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe, a shovel and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Jursun

texts.ru: Журсун 36 лет, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывают трех детей (3 девочки). Образование среднее. Семья у Журсун очень дружная и трудолюбивая. С 2009 года занимается бизнесом по откорму и перпродаже скота, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS), благодаря ее терпению и трудолюбию на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях развития своего бизнеса по откорму и перепродаже скота, Журсун обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS) на покупку коров для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. На доходы от кредита Журсун хочет купить скот.
texts.en: Jursun is 36 years old, married and raising three children (three girls) together with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  Jursun's family is very friendly and hardworking.  She has been involved in the business of fattening up and reselling livestock since 2009, having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her patience and hard work, today she earns a monthly profit in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to develop her business of fattening up and reselling livestock, Jursun requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows for further fattening up and reselling.  Jursun wants to use the earnings from the loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for further fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru:
Баргигул жительница района Хамадони, занимающаяся животноводством. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и является матерью троих сыновей и двух дочерей. Двое ее сыновья женаты. В данное время ее муж вместе с сыновьями находится на заработках в России. Двое ее дочерей учатся в школе, а невестки не работают. Они ведут домашнее хозяйство, а также помогают свевкрови в ее бизнесе. 
Баргигул вот уже 25 лет как успешно занимается животноводством. Она выращивает крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Баргигул нравится ее деятельность, ведь она продолжает ремесло своих предков. Сейчас для развития бизнеса ей необходимо получить кредит. На сумму кредита она хочет приобрести несколько голов крупно-рогатого скота и увеличить его поголовье.
texts.en: Bargigul is a resident of the Hamadoni district and involved in animal husbandry.  She is 50 years, married and a mother of three sons and two daughters.  Two of her sons are married.  At the present time, her husband and sons work in Russia.  Two of her daughters attend a school, and daughters-in-law do not work.  They run the household and also help their mother-in-law with the business.  Bargigul has been successfully involved in animal husbandry for 25 years.  She raises cattle for sale.  Bargigul likes her business because she is continuing the trade of her ancestors.  Currently she needs a loan for developing the business.  She wants to use the loan amount to purchase several heads of cattle and increase cattle headcount.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase cattle headcount

loans.name: Intan Ii Group

texts.en:
Cycle 1 of the group Intan II is over, and the members want to continue for the next cycle. There was no change in group membership in Intan II. They were very helpful to all by the presence of Kiva's loan program, especially because the economy of each member of the family is increasing. 

The Intan group II members still have diverse businesses, such as selling bedspreads, wallets and handbags on credit; selling snacks; selling fried dann and soy milk; starting eateries; selling phone pulses, LP gas, pastries, and vegetables. The planned loan is for the second cycle; they will use it to purchase the means of production and increase the types of businesses. All members of the Intan II group thank you for the loan which was given in cycle 1.

Intan II group is led by a woman named Turyati, who is a single parent of two children. She has one son who is still in school. Turyati has a business selling sheets on credit. With this loan, Turyati plans to add other types of businesses, such as selling clothes and bags on credit, because now there is a lot of competition in the selling of sheets. 

She's is hoping that in the next five years, she can have her own stall. These loans are also expected to increase the business and the income of each member of the group, Intan II.

loans.use: to add other products, such as clothes and bags.

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.ru: Барнохон 44 года, вдова. Одна воспитывает 4 детей (2 сына и 2 дочери). После смерти супруга, Барнохон очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги четверых детей и Барнохон решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. В этом ей помогают дети, старший сын находится на заработках в России, младший работает сварщиком. Оба сына как могут поддерживают семью материально, высылая ежемесячно свою заработную плату. Барнохон имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о предприимчивой и хозяйственной женщине. Барнохон в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается торговлей: постельного белья, одеял, скатертей, начав этот бизнес с 60,000 сом (KGS). Также дополнительным доходом является полеводство, имеет земельный надел размером 1,14 ГА, на которой ежегодно сажает: лук, картофель, капусту. Ее бизнес приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Барнохон вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Барнохон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых товаров: таких как, постельное белье, скатерти, одеяла для дальнейшей розничной перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Барнохон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение товарооборота, а также, намерена в будущем перестроить свой дом.
texts.en: Barnokhon is 44 years old and a widow.  Alone, she is raising four children (two sons and two daughters).  After her husband's death, Barnokhon could not get over the loss of such a close person for a long time.  She needed to raise and get four children on their feet, and Barnokhon decided to take the household and financial responsibility into her own hands.  Her children help her with this.  The oldest son works in Russia, and the youngest works as a welder.  Both sons support the family financially as they can, sending their salaries home monthly.  Barnokhon has a secondary education.  The neighbors speak of her as an entrepreneurial and organized woman.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Barnokhon has been involved in sales of bedding, blankets and table cloths since 2010, having started this business with 60,000 som (KGS).  Farming also yields an income.  She has a 1.14 hectare land plot, where she annually plants onions, potatoes and cabbage.  Her business yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  The income from the business allowed Barnokhon to raise and situate her children.  In order to further develop her business, Barnokhon requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy merchandise, such as bedding, table cloths and blankets, wholesale for future retail sale.  She plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase her goods turnover and also to rebuild her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as bedding, table cloths and blankets, wholesale for future retail sale

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru: Нуринисо 36 летняя швея. Она не замужем и проживает с родителями, братьями и невестками в районе Хамадони. Ее отец работает в лесном хозяйстве района, а братья уехали на заработки. Нуринисо имеет собственный швейный бизнес. Она в 2008 году на рынке района открыла маленький швейный цех и уже 5 лет занимается там предоставлением услуги по пошиву женских национальных платьев. В ее цехе работают несколько работниц. Ее бизнес хорошо продвигается и приносит ей хороший стабильный доход. Нуринисо для расширения своего бизнеса просит кредит. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку. С полученной прибыли она планирует купить один холодильник.
texts.en: Nuriniso is a 36 year-old seamstress.  She is not married and lives with the parents, brothers and sisters-in-law in the Hamadoni district.  Her father works at the district forestry, and brother left for work.  Nuriniso has her own sewing business.  She opened a small sewing factory at a district market in 2008 and has been involved in sewing national women's dresses for 5 years.  Several employees work at this factory.  Her business is going well and yields her a stable income.  Nuriniso is requesting this loan to expand her business.  She wants to buy a new sewing machine.  She plans to use the resulting profit to buy one refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Panji

texts.ru: Панжи житель района Кубадиён. Ему 49 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих сыновей и двух дочерей. Панжи земледелец. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. У него имеется 0,12 га приусадебного участка земли. Дети Панжи уже повзрослели. Их необходимо обустроить в жизни, дать им образование, женить. Поэтому Панжи хочет заняться новым бизнесом и выбрал для этого животноводство. Он будет совмещать земледелие с животноводством. Панжи накопил сбережение в размере 3000 таджикских сомони, а также во дворе дома имеет коровник. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить 5 голов коров и телят, а также корм. Панжи будет откармливать скот в течение одного месяца и затем продавать на местном рынке по прибыльной цене. Он уже составил свой бизнес-план и теперь ожидает поддержки.
texts.en: Panji is a resident of the Qubadiyon district.  He is 49 years old, married and has two sons and two daughters.  Panji is a farmer.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He has 0.12 hectares of land by his house.  Panji's children are already grown.  They need to be situated in life, provided with education and married off.  This is why Panji wants to get involved in a new business and chose animal husbandry.  He will combine farming with animal husbandry.  Panji saved 3000 Tajik somoni and also has a cowshed in his house yard.  He requested a loan to buy five heads of cows and calves and also livestock feed.  Panji will fatten up livestock for one month and then sell it a local market at a profitable price.  He already created his business plan and now awaits support.

loans.use: to buy five heads of cows and calves and also livestock feed in order to start a new business

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel posee  48 años, es casado, procreo 4 hijos todos mayores de edad y solo viven con un hijo, la esposa de su hijo  y dos nietas.

El es albañil, trabajo que realiza desde que era joven. Antes vivia en otra zona, pero por el conflicto civil en el país, se traslado a su domicilio actual. Ahí conoció a la que ahora es su esposa. Cuando vivia con sus padres en el lugar inicial, fue donde empezó como ayudante de albañil, luego con su esfuerzo y dedicación perfeccionó el oficio y ahora trabaja por su propia cuenta. También, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz para el consumo familiar.

 El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción de una cocina de ladrillo, pues la que actualmente tiene esta  elaborada en el corredor,  sus bases son de horcones y lamina, que esta bastante deteriorada por la lluvia y se moja la honrilla de leña y un granero donde almacena el maíz que cosecha.


Él espera tener una mejor construcción en su casa y evitar que esa construcción vieja le pueda causar un accidente a alguien de su familia, porque cuando hace mucho viento fuerte o lluvias tempestuosas parece que se cae. Por otra parte, evita que los animales domésticos entren a ese lugar; ya que se tiene problemas porque los perros y gallinas se suben a la hornilla y se comen o deterioran los alimentos .
texts.en:
Michael is 48 years old, married and has 4 adult children. He lives with one son, his daughter-in-law and two granddaughters.

He has been a mason since he was young. Before, he lived in another area but because of the civil conflict in the country, he moved to his current location. There he met the woman who is now his wife. When he lived with his parents in the first location he became an assistant mason. Through his effort and dedication he perfected his craft and now works on his own. He also works in agriculture and plants corn for his family to eat.
 
The loan will be used to purchase materials to build a brick oven, which is currently constructed in the corridor. The oven is currently damaged by rain, as are the wood-burning stove and the barn where he stores the corn harvest.

He also hopes to improve the construction of his home to avoid an accident involving someone in his family, because when there is strong wind or rain it looks like it might fall down. He would also like to prevent his pets from entering this area, because he has problems with the dogs and chickens getting on the oven and eating or spoiling the food.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a brick oven.

loans.name: Orostamo

texts.ru: Оростамо 41 год. Она замужняя женщина, имеющая троих сыновей, которым по 16,15 и 13 лет. Все они учатся в школе. У Оростамо семейный торговый бизнес. Она совместно с мужем занимается продажей канцелярских товаров. В частности она продает тетради, ручки, бумаги размера А4, папки, альбомы, циркуль и т.д. Ее магазин расположен на центральном рынке города. Оростамо начала этот бизнес в 2007 году и до сих пор продолжает его. Так как сейчас сезон покупок школьных принадлежностей, Оростамо необходимо увеличить ассортимент своих товаров. С этой целью она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она собирается приобрести широкий ассортимент канцелярских товаров и таким образом увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Orostamo is 41 years old.  She is a married woman, who has three sons, ages 16, 15 and 13.  All of them attend a school.  Orostamo has a family retail business.  She and her husband are involved in selling office goods.  Specifically, she sells notebooks, pens, A4 size paper, binders, albums, compasses, etc.  Her store is located at the city central market.  Orostamo started this business in 2007 and continues it still.  Orostamo needs to expand her merchandise selection because this is the season for buying school supplies.  She requested a loan for this purpose.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a wide selection of office supplies and thus increase her good turnover.

loans.use: to buy a wide selection of office supplies and thus increase her good turnover

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхон житель северной части Таджикистана города Худжанд. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одну трехлетнюю дочь. Амирхон энергичный и отзывчивый человек. Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. Его жена домохозяйка, а дочь ходит в детский сад. Амирхон в течение 6 лет работает таксистом по маршрутной линии своего города. Его рабочий день начинается с 5:00 часов утра и продолжается до 17:00 часов вечера. Амирхон работает усердно, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Прибыль с деятельности является единственным источником его дохода. Амирхон сейчас нуждается в кредите. Он просит кредит для приобретения автомобильных шин, чтобы заменить старые шины на новых и продолжить деятельность.
texts.en: Amirkhon is a resident of the northern part of Tajikistan, the city of Khujand.  He is 26 years old, married and has one three-year-old daughter.  Amirkhon is an energetic and responsive person.  He earns a living by providing a taxi service.  His wife is a homemaker, and daughter goes to a kindergarten.  Amirkhon has been working as a taxi driver along the shuttle route of his city for 6 years.  His work day starts at 5:00 in the morning and continues until 17:00 in the evening.  Amirkhon works diligently to provide for his family.  The profit from the business is the sole source of income for him.  Amirkhon currently needs a loan.  He is requesting this loan to buy car tires in order to replace old tires with new ones and continue his business.

loans.use: to buy car tires in order to replace old tires with new ones and continue his business

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он не женат и является студентом 3 курса. Он учится в Российской Федерации в городе Самаре. Акмал учится отлично и хорошо. Он начитанный молодой человек и всегда в поиске новшества. Во время каникулы Акмал приезжает домой в Таджикистан. Он помогает маме по садоводству. Акмал должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. В будущем он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом.
texts.en: Akmal is a hardworking and conscientious person.  He is not married and a third-year student.  He studies in the Russian Federation in the city of Samara.  Akmal studied excellently in school.  He is a well-read young person and always seeks something new.  Akmal comes home to Tajikistan during his school breaks.  He helps his mother with gardening.  Akmal has to pay for his tuition contract, but does not have money.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3900 US dollars to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.  He dreams of becoming a good specialist in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase peas and all kinds of vegetables.

loans.name: Tala

texts.en:
Tala is 30 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Tala needs a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals and filings for the plantation.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services. Tala will use the profits from her sales to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals and filings.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lusia has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, a file, gloves, boots, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Lusia hopes to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, a file, gloves, boots, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 42-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small business, providing a tailoring service to the community. She has many years with this business. Tina needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, needles, threads and oil. She will use her profits to support her children's education. Tina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, threads, needles and oil.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 32 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Гулнора более 15 лет занимается бизнесом. Она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Данное время она занимается купле продажей промышленных товаров, как мыло, шампунь, стиральный порошок и т.д. Она имеет свою торговую точку. Гулнора работает упорно с раннего утра, так как семья у них большая 10 человек, и она должна зарабатывать много денег, чтобы содержать семью. Гулнора планирует увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для покупки промышленных товаров как мыло, порошок и т.п. В будущем она планирует открыть собственный магазин. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnora is a hardworking woman.  She is 32 years old.  She is divorced and does not have children.  Gulnora has been a businesswoman for over 15 years.  She started her business by sewing women's clothes.  Today she buys and sells manufactured goods such as soap, shampoo, detergent, etc.  She has her own sales location.  Gulnora works hard from early morning, as her family is large and has 10 people and she needs to earn a lot of money to support the family.  Gulnora plans to increase her working capital.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 US dollars for the purchase of products such as soap, detergent, etc.  In the future, she plans to open her own store.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy manufactured goods such as soap and detergent and to increase working capital

loans.name: Dúo Solidario La Finquita Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO LA FINQUITA
LA SEÑORA VICTORIA DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD QUIEN ES PROPIETARIA DE VACAS Y TERNERITAS QUE TIENE EN SU CASA, ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE 4 HIJOS ES UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA QUE DIA A DIA LUCHA POR SALIR ADELANTE Y BUSCAR MEJORAS EN SU FAMILIA ELLA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO SE LEVANTA PARA ORDEÑAR Y LUEGO SALIR A VENDER LA LECHE DENTRO DE LA COMUNIDAD TIENE MUCHOS SUEÑOS Y METAS QUE DESEA QUE ALGUN DIA SE CUMPLAN Y SE LLEVEN A CABO DENTRO DE SUS ACTIVIDADES CUANDO SE DESOCUPA SALEN A PASTOREAR LAS VACAS LUEGO A ALIMENTARLAS PARA TENERLAS LISTAS PARA EL SIGUIENTE DIA ELLA DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SE CONVIERTAN EN PERSONAS DE BIEN PARA QUE PUEDAN TENER UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA AL QUE ELLA HA TENIDO ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE VACAS LECHERAS PARA TENER UNA MAYOR CANTIDAD DE LECHE PARA LA VENTA Y ASI TENER MEJORES GANANCIAS PARA AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: Victoria is 35 years old and owns cows and calves that she keeps at home. This mother of four children is an enterprising woman who fights day to day to make headway and find the best for her family. She gets up very early to milk her cows and then she goes out to sell the milk within the community. She has a lot of dreams and goals that she hopes one day to fulfill and tries to work toward them when she has time while the cows are grazing. Victoria wants her children to become good people who can have a better lifestyle than she has had. She is requesting the loan to purchase cows to increase the amount of milk she sells, and in this way she will have more profits to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Diariatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une entente et un esprit d’être aide  entre les membres du groupe, Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Diariatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont deux filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et autres articles vestimentaires. Elle se procure la marchandise au marché dans les régions du central ou à la capitale, pour la revente à crédit en deux mensualités.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des habits pour enfants par douzaines pour la revente au détail par unité.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire participer de manière significative à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Created July 16, 2012, the banc villageois is made up of women who are very committed and eager to make their revenue-generating businesses prosper. Harmony and a helping spirit exist between the members of the group. They all live in the same neighborhood and are primarily active in small business.

Ms. Diariatou (standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of five children, of which two are girls. She got started in the sale of fabrics and other articles of clothing. She gets her merchandise at the market in the central regions or in the capital, to resell it for credit in two monthly installments. With this new loan, she expects to buy children's clothing by the dozen to resell individually at retail. With the profits she wants to participate in a significant way to taking care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing by the dozen to resell at retail individually.

loans.name: Mamanding's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 21 juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices e revenus.  Elles viennent  d’entamer leur troisième cycle et commencent à maitriser le programme. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village. Elles  entretiennent des relations de bon voisinage depuis plusieurs années et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, accompagné de la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame  Mamanding  (debout à l’extrême droit et en médaillon en bas à gauche) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère 05 enfants dont 01 garçon et 04 filles, elle est âgée  de 42 ans. Elle vend le petit déjeuner au village. Pour ce faire elle achète les produits suivants pour la préparation : du niébé, des haricots, des œufs, du lait et des assaisonnements. Cependant le pain est acheté chaque matin suivant la quantité souhaitée. 
   
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter du niébé, des haricots, une tablette d’œufs du lait et des assaisonnements pour la préparation des mets.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la scolarité de ses filles.
texts.en:
Created on July 21, the banc villageois is made up of  women who are very committed to the development of revenue-generating activities. They are starting their third cycle and are beginning to master the program. They all live in the same village.  They have maintained good neighborly relations for several years and have small businesses as their main activity, along with seasonal farming in the rain. 

Ms. Mamanding (standing to the far right and in the medallion to the lower left) is the star lender of the group. She is married, mother to 5 children, of which one is a boy and four are girls, and she is 42 years old. She sells breakfast in the village. In order to do so, she purchases the following items for the preparation: black-eyed peas, beans, eggs, milk and seasonings. However, the bread is bought each morning according to the quantity desired.

With her new loan, she expects to buy black-eyed peas, beans, a carton of eggs, milk and seasonings for the preparation of the dishes. With the profits, she expects to support her husband in the management of their daughters' schooling.

loans.use: to purchase black-eyed peas, beans, a carton of eggs, milk, and seasonings for the preparation of dishes.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 60 years old, married and she works hard to help her husband to earn a living.

Thelma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a retail rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling charcoal. Delia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 06 Juin 2002 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide.

Madame Sokhna (Mariama debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 01 garçon et 03 filles. Elle est  très enthousiasme et  fait le commerce de jus de fruits naturels locaux et de glace dans les marchés hebdomadaires des environs de son village. Pour ce faire, elle achète du sucre, des colorants alimentaires selon le parfum et du pain de singe, feuilles de bissap et des emballages en plastique. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter : deux sacs de 50 kilos de pain de singe, un sac de feuilles de bissap, un sac de sucre et des colorants alimentaires.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, soutenir son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very committed women who, since the creation of the banc villageois on June 6, 2002, knew to develop, along with more revenue-generating activities generally turned towards small business, strong bonds of solidarity and mutual assistance.

Ms. Sokhna (standing to the far right) is the star borrower of this group.  She is married, and the mother of four children of which one is a boy and three are girls. She is very enthusiastic and runs a local natural fruit juice and ice cream business in the weekly markets surrounding her village. To do this, she buys sugar, food coloring according to the flavor, and monkey bread, hibiscus leaves and plastic wrapping. Her new loan will allow her to buy: two 50 kilogram bags of monkey bread, a bag of hibiscus leaves, a bag of sugar and food coloring. With the profits, she expects to improve the living conditions of her family and support her husband in managing the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy two 50 kilogram bags of monkey bread, a bag of hibiscus leaves, a bag of sugar, and food coloring.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 50 years old and married with five children, three of whom attend school.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Leuatogi

texts.en:
Leuatogi is a 42-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and raises chickens to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Leuatogi has requested a loan to buy a wire fence, a bag of rice for chicken food, cement and a water hose. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Leuatogi hopes to improve her house and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy a wire fence, a bag of rice for chicken food, cement and a water hose

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to pays for her laborers' salary during harvest.

Rosemarie has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pays for her laborers' salary during harvest

loans.name: Maauga

texts.en:
Maauga is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Maauga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush-knives, a pick, a chainsaw and a backpack sprayer.
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Maauga hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, a pick, a chainsaw and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Suluga

texts.en: Suluga is 39 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. Suluga has requested a loan to pay for her children's school fees,and to buy cement, iron roofing and ceiling board for home improvements. Part of her loan will buy flour, sugar and yeast for her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Suluga will save more in her account for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, yeast, cement, iron roofing and ceiling board, and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Tailua

texts.en:
Tailua is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tailua has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a wheel barrow, taro roots and to pay for her children's school fees. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Tailua hopes to improve her house and save more for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bushknives, a wheelbarrow, taro root and pay school fees

loans.name: Meva

texts.en:
Meva is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. To earn extra income, she also has a canteen business. She has been doing this for many years. Meva has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, a file, sugar, rice, noodles and to pay school fees.
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Meva hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, bushknives, a file, sugar, rice, noodles and to pay school fees

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 50 years old and married with three children, two of whom attend school. Leonor works very hard to provide for them.

Leonor runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as spices, eggs, noodles, sugar, milk and coffee. Leonor has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Leonor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as spices, eggs, noodles, sugar, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Vainuu

texts.en:
Vainuu is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Vainuu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer and a rake. 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Vainuu hopes to improve her house and save more for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer and a rake

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faavae is a 43-year-old divorced woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faavae has requested a loan to buy taro root, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, bushknives and a wheelbarrow.
She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Faavae hopes to save more in her account for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy taro root, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, bushknives and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa is 63 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonesa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Leonesa has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Vernilyn

texts.en: Vernilyn is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has an eight-year-old son. She runs an eatery. She sells home-made meals like tinolang isda (soup with fish), fried chicken, stewed vegetables, meat and other native menu items. She has been running an eatery for almost 5 years. She requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy more ingredients such as pork, chicken, meat and an additional table and chairs. This will help her to provide her customers with good food and quality services. In the future, Vernilyn would like to improve her livelihood status and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as pork, chicken, meat and an additional table and chairs

loans.name: Rulina

texts.en: Rulina is a 36-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 3 children aged 9, 4 and 4 months old. She has been growing and selling rice for more than 5 years. Her husband works as a security guard in a private company. Rulina needs capital to sustain her livelihood activity so she has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides, to have a bountiful harvest. In the future, Rulina would like to expand her farming business to support the education of her children and have a stable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase household stocks to sell such as canned goods, coffee, noodles, milk and sugar for her general store business.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years. Lourdes earns more income from buying and selling feeds and also from motorcycle transport.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase household stocks to sell such as canned goods, coffee, noodles, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Maricyl

texts.en:
Maricyl is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricyl is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maricyl has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as chips, milk, soap and canned goods. Maricyl has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Maricyl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as chips, milk, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and married with two children who are in school. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Mary Jel

texts.en:
Mary Jel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Mary Jel has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Mary Jel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 62 years old and married with six children. Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as noodles, soap, canned goods and chips. Rosario has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Rosario aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as noodles, soap, canned goods and chips

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melody works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Melody is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets for her business.

Melody has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 11 years. Marilyn also earns income from rice retailing and raising pigs.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and from farming vegetables. Marilou is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional beauty products for her beauty products business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta is a 49-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 14. She engages in a fishing business and has been selling fish for almost 3 years. Her husband's income as a carpenter is just enough for the family's daily needs. Modesta has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to buy fishing nets to improve her catch and augment her income. Modesta hopes that she can purchase a new fishing boat and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Letty works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Letty is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Letty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional beauty products for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 8 years. Erlinda also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 62 years old and married with ten children.

Cresencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like milk, sugar, canned goods, chips, etc.

Cresencia has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cresencia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like milk, sugar, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Lene works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and a general store. Lene is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mariter

texts.en: Mariter is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest is 24 while the youngest is 8. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like biscuits, noodles, chips, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and toiletries. She has been running a variety store for almost 10 years. Due to inadequate capital to maintain the store inventory, Mariter requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more stock like soft drinks, canned goods and to pay for the laborer, with her livelihood activity going back to normal. In the future, Mariter hopes that she could finish sending all her children to get a college education out of the earnings of the store as well as expand for progress and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soft drinks and canned goods and to pay for the laborer

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 45 years old and is married with seven children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Felicidad has been in this business for one year and also earns additional income from general store.

Felicidad is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 70 years old and is widowed with four children. Flaviana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. Flaviana has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil, dried fish and canned goods, etc. 

Flaviana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Gerlie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Now, Gerlie has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

In the future, Gerlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and is married with five children. With three children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as cream, coffee, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like cream, coffee, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like cream, coffee, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios microempresarios uno de ellos es Roberto hombre de 30 años de edad, acompañado, con dos hijos menores que dependen de el de 4 y 3 años, su negocio es la venta de frutas desde hace 8 años  en la comarca las flores, sus productos se los vende a personas extranjeras como costarricenses y hondureños. El crédito lo requiere para comprar cosechas de mango y tamarindo. Gladys joven de 20 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosechas y Sandra mujer de 32 años de edad  y su negocio es la venta de tortillas y güirilas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members with micro businesses. One of them is Roberto who is 30 years old and has a partner and 2 young children aged 4 and 3 years who depend on him. He has been selling fruit in the Las Flores area for 8 years, selling his produce to foreigners such as Costa Ricans and Hondurans. 

He needs the loan to buy mango and tamarind harvests. 

Gladys who is 20 years old sells crops and 32-year-old Sandra has a business selling tortillas and thick corn pancakes.

loans.use: to buy mango and tamarind harvests.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is 55 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonida has a business buying and selling bananas, vegetables and rootcrops in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

She has requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas, vegetables and rootcrops to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, vegetables and rootcrops to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, such as noodles, soda and beverages, canned goods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a merchant from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Alicia has been in business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy more stock, like canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, cooking ingredients and others. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to cater for more buyers in her store. Alicia wants to expand her store in the future so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, cooking ingredients and others.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom is still in school.

Lita has a business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in the business of pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities.

Now, Lita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Lita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Berly

texts.en:
Ma. Berly works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 19 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Ma. Berly has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old, and is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maria has a business buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in the business for two years. Maria has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married, and has a business making native bags in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

Marites requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business making native bags.

loans.name: Alladin

texts.en:
Alladin is a retailer of local food supplements in Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income. 

Alladin is asking for a loan to buy more food supplements to sell to his customers. With this, he will be able to improve his sales as well as his income. In the future, Alladin hopes of making his business a success and a stable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy more food supplements to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a 50-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in fishing and sells fish. She has been selling fish for several years. Her husband is also a fisherman. They work hand in hand to earn a living.

She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net, nylon and lift weights, which are all very beneficial in her fishing activities. 

In the future, Eufemia hopes that her fishing business will progress and lead to a stable source of income, to provide proper food and good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like fishing net, nylon and lift weights.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 19 years now. This is the source of their income.

Amelita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Amelita hopes of making her business a success and saves money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Luisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and buying and selling charcoal. Luisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es: Don Santos de 40 años de edad,  vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos ellos estudian actualmente, el trabaja de jornal en una granja que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, don santos desea mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y el piso, pero con lo que gana de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón está solicitando un crédito para la compra de laminas, clavos, ladrillos para el piso, cemento y todos los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo ya que el transcurso del  tiempo la ha dejado en muy malas condiciones su vivienda con esto espera brindarle a su familia seguridad en su hogar.
texts.en: Mr. Santos is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two school-age children. He works on a farm near his home. Mr. Santos would like to make improvements on his house, which would include changing the roof and the floor, but with what he makes at work he isn't able to reach that goal. This is why he is applying for a loan to buy metal sheeting, nails, flooring bricks, cement, and all of the materials necessary for the job. Over time his house has deteriorated and is now in very bad condition, and with these materials he hopes to be able to give his family a safer place to live.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, nails, flooring bricks, cement. etc.

loans.name: Neri Elmer Ivan

texts.es:
Neri, vive con su familia, su compañera de vida y disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 18 y 22 años, ninguno depende de él y no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la venta de papelería y también ofrece servicio de fotocopias e impresiones, actividad que la realiza de 6:00am a 5:30pm y lo desempeña desde hace 8 años, hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que solicita le servirá para la reparación de fotocopiadoras; esta inversión le ayudara a brindarles un mejor servicio a los clientes y obtener mayores utilidades. 
Sus sueños son crear un record crediticio, apoyar a sus hijos económica para que se preparen académicamente y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Neri lives with his wife and two children, who are 18 and 22 years old. Neither of them are dependent upon him and he does not have any relatives abroad. He sells stationary products and he also offers a photocopy and printing service, something that he does from 6:00 AM until 5:30 PM, and he has been working at it for the past eight years. So far he has not had any problems.

The loan for which he is applying will allow him to pay for repairs on his photocopiers. This investment will help him give his clients better service and help him make higher profits.

His dreams are to create a credit record, economically support his children so that they may study, and build his own house.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of photocopiers.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four young children. Analiza also runs a sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her community. 

Analiza is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and groceries for her store such as canned goods, candies, snack foods, soda, soap and toiletries. With this loan, Analiza will be able to improve the productivity of her farm as well as of her store.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer for the farm and groceries for her store such as canned goods, candies, snack foods, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 34-years-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 3 children. The oldest is 13 while the youngest is 4. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, noodles, ice candy, biscuits and canned goods. Her husband works as an electrician.

To be able to meet the family's daily needs, Julieta requested a loan of 4000 PHP to buy more inventory such as soft drinks, beverages, condiments, and canned goods. She is very thankful for the loan so that she can maintain the store inventory and also attract more customers. Julieta hopes to improve her variety store business to support her family and to send all her children through a college education.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of drinks, beverages, condiments, and canned goods.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. 

Carolina needs a loan to improve her store. She is asking for  a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries and snack foods. With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, toiletries and snack foods.

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 24 años de edad, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque vive al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere mucho y desea ser un orgullo para ellos. Con mucho esfuerzo Nelly trabaja ccomo secretaria de un estudio jurídica de su ciudad, y con los ingresos de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de estudios de Secretariado; Nelly cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Nelly está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora, con la cual podrá realizar sus trabajos y ya no gastara dinero en alquilar una computadora en una cabina de internet, de esta manera podrá mejorar, tener los materiales necesarios para poder estudiar y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y poder tener un buen empleo”.
texts.en:
Nelly is 24 years old and is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead, above all because she lives with her parents who love her very much and she wants to make them proud.  With great effort Nelly works as a secretary for a judicial office in her city.  With the income from her job she is able to pay for her coursework in "Secretarial Studies." Nelly believes that she is doing well because she is responsible and above all because she has a great desire to get ahead.

Nelly is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to purchase a computer, with which she will complete her work and not waste money renting a computer in an internet cafe.  In this way she will be able to improve, to have the materials necessary for studying and for continuing to struggle to make her great dream a reality: "To be a great professional and to be able to have a good job."

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell seafood business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional seafood to sell for her business.

Rodita has been in this business for 15 years. Rodita earns additional income from her pig fattening and fishing businesses.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 60 years old and married with two children. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like bread, salt, sugar, cooking oil, soft-drinks, etc., in her general store. Elsa has been in this business for 2 years. 

Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like bread, salt, sugar, cooking oil, soft-drinks, etc., in her general store.

loans.name: Clement Stephen

texts.en:
Clement is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. He is 28 years of age and is married. He resides in Yei town South Sudan. He is a businessman who has a pharmacy. He has been doing this pharmacy business for about one year. 

He is taking a loan worth 2,000 South Sudanese Pounds to expand his business. He will use the money to buy more medicine and have a variety in his pharmacy. His main challenge is the unavailability of supply but he is optimistic that things will change soon.

loans.use: To buy more medicine and drugs for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Claudia Stella

texts.es: Claudia de 29 años de edad habita en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe y con un potencial turístico importante. Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancías, mediante guías especializadas de productos, como cremas, colonias, perfumes etc. Desde hace dos años, inició su experiencia emprendedora, cuando su hermana, también comerciante, le propuso se dedicara a esta actividad, para generar ingresos, que contribuyeran con los gastos de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4, 7 y 8 años. En su negocio los principales artículos que forman su oferta, son las cremas corporales, las colonias, la perfumería y cosméticos en general. Sus productos los ofrece a crédito y de contado, durante todos los días, entre amigos, vecinos y referidos de sus propios clientes satisfechos.  Claudia vende a crédito y de contado todos los días, en los horarios de 8 de la mañana a las 8 de la noche, y compra de contado a empresas que distribuyen mediante catálogos. Su meta es abrir un local  público   y más adelante tener vivienda propia. Para ello debe aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores posibilidades de ingresos, por eso trabaja permanentemente.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará perfumería, colonias, cremas y cosméticos procurando así ofrecer una diversidad de productos a sus clientes, para generar cada vez mejores ganancias y lograr su sueño de prosperidad en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en: Claudia is 29 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, located on the shore of the Caribbean and with great touristic potential.  She works there selling merchandise via specialized product catalogues, including cremes, colognes, perfumes, etc.  She began her enterprising experience two years ago when her sister, also a business woman, proposed that she dedicate herself to this work in order to generate income that would contribute to her household expenses. She lives with her life partner and their three children ages 4, 7, and 8.  In her business the principle products that she sells are body creams, colognes, perfume and general cosmetics.  Her products are sold on credit and for cash, every day, among friends, neighbors, and those referred by satisfied clients.  Claudia works daily from 8am to 8pm and she purchases her products with cash from businesses that distribute via catalog. Her goal is to open her own public shop and eventually have her own home.  For that reason she must increase her sales and generate greater income options, and for that reason she works constantly.  Currently she is applying for a kiva credit, her first loan from the foundation Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will buy perfume, cologne, cremes, and cosmetics, thereby offering a diverse array of products to her clients.  This will help her increase her income and achieve her dream of prosperity in the not so distant future.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, cologne, cremes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Dagbegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DAGBEGNON est composé de quatre personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Afiavi Pauline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 43 ans. Afiavi Pauline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Afiavi Pauline est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Afiavi Pauline vit seule avec son mari. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Afiavi Pauline vend de la nourriture dans sa région depuis deux ans. Comme activité secondaire Afiavi Pauline vend des tissus. Afiavi Pauline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Afiavi Pauline s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe DAGBEGNON pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Dagbegnon group is made up of four people, who all live in the same area. The representative of the group, Afiavi Pauline (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 43 years old. Afiavi Pauline did not go to school. She is married to a certain Lucien, and they do not have any children. Afiavi Pauline lives alone with her husband, and they both are responsible for their household needs.

To do this, Afiavi Pauline procures goods in a Benin market [and resells them].

In order to increase her sales and to satisfy customer demand, Afiavi Pauline joined with the other members of the Dagbegnon group to seek their third loan with Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy condiments, vegetable oil, and fabric

loans.name: Ndeye Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 06 Juin 2002 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide.

Madame Ndèye Aminata (debout à droite avec une main levée ), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une restauratrice très renommée dans la zone. Elle est, mariée et mère 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. Elle tient une gargote dans le village où elle vend le petit déjeuner. Elle s’approvisionne en denrées de premier nécessite dans les marches hebdomadaires et chez les grossistes dans la capitale régionale au besoin. Elle fait de bonnes prestation ce qui fait qu’elle a une clientèle importante.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner en denrées premières nécessitées entrant dans le processus de préparation de mets.

En plus de renforcer son épargne pour bénéficier de prêt plus important, elle compte soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very committed women, who have been developing [their businesses] since the creation of the banc villageois on 6 June 2002. In addition to the income generating activities centered around small-scale commerce, [these women have also developed] strong bonds of solidarity and mutual aid. 

Ndeye Aminata (standing on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is married and a mother of seven children, four boys and three girls. 

Ndeye Aminata has a small restaurant in the village where she sells breakfast. It is well-known in the area.

She procures the raw goods that she needs from weekly markets and from wholesalers in the regional capital. She is an important customer because of her good service.

With this new loan, she plans to buy the raw goods she needs to make her meals. 

In addition to increasing her savings in order to qualify for a larger loan, she also hopes to support her children in their schooling.

loans.use: to procure the raw goods needed to prepare meals

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
