From the city of Nablus, Yousef is a 33-year-old married father of a small daughter. For the past two years, Yousef has been selling electrical appliances in the store he owns. It is a profitable business and well known in his city.

Yousef would like to improve his store and so has requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more modern refrigerators to resell, thereby improving both his business and his income.

loans.use: to buy more modern refrigerators to resell in his store

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 06 Juin 2002 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide.

Madame Aïssatou (assise à  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 05 enfants dont 04 filles et un garçon qui sont âgés de 09 à 17 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce de tissus et de prêt à porter pour enfant. Elle s’approvisionne au près de commerçants dans les marchés de la capitale. Pour la revente soit au compte lors de « loumas » marchés hebdomadaires et à crédit par deux échéances aux clients de son village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, en préparatif des ouvertures de classe et fête de Tabaski, elle compte achète des prêts à porter pour enfant.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte de venir en aide à son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very committed women who have been working together since the creation of the banc villageois on 6 June 2002. In addition to the income generating activities which center around small-scale commerce, the group has also developed strong bonds of solidarity and mutual aid.

Aissatou (seated on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is married and a mother of five children, four girls and one boy, who age from nine to 17 years old. 

Aissatou works selling fabric and ready-to-wear children's clothing. She procures her goods from merchants at the markets in the capital and resells them at either the "louma" weekly markets or for credit to customers in her village, who can pay in two installments.

With this new loan, she plans to buy ready-to-wear children's clothing in preparation for the start of school and the Tabaski festival.

With the earnings, she plans to help her husband with the family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear children's clothing

loans.name: Nonvignongbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNONGBE est composé de neuf personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. Baï Pétronille (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), est la représente de ce groupe. Baï Pétronille est âgée de 55 ans est veuve avec un enfant, scolarisé et à sa charge. Baï Pétronille n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Baï Pétronille vit seule avec son enfant. Les différentes du ménage sont assurées par elle. Pour ce faire Baï Pétronille vend des condiments et divers articles à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution depuis dix ans. Baï Pétronille s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité,Baï Pétronille s’associe aux autres membres du groupe NONVIGNONGBE pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Nonvignongbe group is made up of nine people who all live in the same neighborhood. Bai Petronille (whose hand is raised in the photo) is the representative of the group. Bai Petronille is 55 years old and did not go to school. She is a widow with one child, who goes to school and is still under her care. Bai Petronille lives alone with her child and is responsible for supporting their needs.

To do this, Bai Petronille has been selling condiments and other goods from her home and by a distribution method for ten years. She procures her goods from a Benin market.

In order to increase her business, Bai Petronille has joined with the other members of the Nonvignongbe group to seek their third loan with Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy condiments and other various goods

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a merchant from the town of San Miguel in Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or convenience store where she sells various goods and items to the people in her locale. She is also into rice farming.

Daniela is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. Daniela hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Birashoboka Ii Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe  Birashoboka II et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 24 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de viande  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de viande, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait   devenir un grand commerçant, importateur des produits de la Tanzanie.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the Birashoboka II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 24 years old and single. 

Emmanuel has been selling meat for five years. He is on his third loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of meat, which he will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to become an important merchant and an importer of goods from Tanzania.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of meat to resell

loans.name: Mary Anthony

texts.en: Mary is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. She is 29 years of age. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. Mary found out about Finance South Sudan through marketing and promotions. She is a businesswoman who runs a beauty shop in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for about 6 years and has employed 4 staff to help her run the business. Her main challenges in the business are marketing and transportation problems. Mary is borrowing a loan of 2000 SSP to help her buy more products like skin oil, hair oil and weaves for her beauty shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like skin oil, hair oil, weaves and other items.

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Cecilia de 38 años  vive en casa propia  con su grupo  familiar que está conformado por sus  tres hijos y su tía de 50 años de edad,   es una mujer que cada día   se levanta con la esperanza de poder realizar  sus labores  y de esa manera poder llevar  el pan  diario  a su casa  y a sus hijos, sus ingresos  dependen  de una venta  de tamales el cual tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia  es así como ella lucha  día con día  para poder mantener  con lo suficiente  a su hogar,   Cecilia solicita  un crédito  para poder hacerle unas mejoras  a la  vivienda  lo cual consiste en hacer una pared en la parte de enfrente de su casa pero como no tiene el capital suficiente para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita el crédito y asi comprar arena, ladrillos, cemento y pago de mano de obra , y darle a su familia  más seguridad.
texts.en: Cecilia is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her family group, which consists of her three children and her 50-year-old aunt. She is a woman who gets up every day with the hope of being able to carry out her work and thus provide the daily bread to her home and her children. Her income depends on a sales stand for tamales, which is located in her place of residence. She works hard day after day so that she can maintain her household and provide what is necessary. Cecilia is requesting a loan so that she can make some improvements to her home by constructing a wall in front of her house. However, she does not have enough capital to carry this out, and for that reason she is requesting the loan so that she can buy cement, bricks and sand, and also pay for labor. This will give her family more security.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. 

He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years. This is the source of his income.

Gregorio is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch, giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es: José de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 26 años de edad, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up por las diferentes colonias donde el reside desde hace 10 años con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, tiene mucha cliente pues la buscan pro la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar y la amabilidad en que atiende a sus clientes, don jose esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar repuestos y llantas ya que su vehículo es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su hijo un mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: José, 60, lives in his own house with his son who is 26. He makes his living making trips in his pickup around the different neighborhoods where he lives. He has been doing this for 10 years and what he earns from his work lets him afford the costs of his home. He has many customers, in fact, they look for him because he is timely and friendly in attending his customers. José is asking for a loan to be able to buy parts and tires given that his vehicle is his only source of work and therefore can give his son better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy parts and tires.

loans.name: Inesa

texts.en:
Inesa is a merchant from San Miguel, Bohol. She has run a variety store for more than three years. It is the source of her income.

Inesa is requesting a loan to buy stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries. 

With this loan, Inesa will be able to increase her stock and attract more buyers, thus growing her sales and income. Inesa dreams of expanding her store one day.

loans.use: to buy stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es: Amado, tiene la edad de 63 años, es soltero, y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere  comprar abono e insumos  para asistir su cafetal   en finca  que es de su propiedad.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijo la educación necesaria  para que sea en el futuro  persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Amado, 63, is single and has one son who is his highest priority. He wants to buy fertilizer and supplies to help his coffee plantation which is his property. He has been working on his farm for several years and he wants to grow and desires his farm to be very productive.

This is the second loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not taken out other loans in state banks or cooperatives, but FUDECOSUR gave him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. He also wishes to provide the necessary education to his son so that in the future he will be a prepared person and can face a much easier way of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies for coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, candy, soda, soap, toiletries, cooking ingredients and other items.

loans.name: Mamiliana

texts.en:
Mamiliana is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the farming business for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income.

Mamiliana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. 

With this loan, Mamiliana will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus increasing her yield and income. Mamiliana hopes of expanding her farming venture in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 34-years-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and three young sons in a small house. 

For the past 13 years, Majed has been working in a workshop, making furniture. It is the family business but now Majed managing it. It is a profitable project and earns a good income but the raw materials are very expensive. 

Majed took a USD Murabaha loan from FAEN. This loan will help him to buy textiles for making furniture. This will help Majed to meet the demand for the summer season and his income will be increased. 

Majed appears in the photo while he is working in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making furniture.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Hiba is a 23-year-old single woman from a small village near Ramallah. She lives with her family. Hiba and her brother would like to open a small chicken farm to sell  meat. It is a profitable project. 

Hiba took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to start her own project by buying all the necessary tools and feed for the chicken farm. This project will earn a good income and improve the family's living conditions. 

Hiba and her brother dream to take a bigger loan in the future and expand their farm.

loans.use: to start her own project by buying all the necessary tools and feed for the chicken farm.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios runs a sari-sari or variety store in her place in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Remedios is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and serve more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Veronico

texts.en:
Veronico runs a sari-sari or variety store in his place in Trinidad, Bohol. He sells various goods and items to the people in his place. 

Veronico is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, he will be able to attract and cater more buyers in his store, thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna is 25-years-old and married with two children, one of whom in school. Dyna works very hard to provide for them.

Dyna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

Dyna has been in this business for two years.

In the future Dyna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a crab selling business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 27 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Paublina De La Cruz

texts.es: Paublina es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, madre de dos hijos menores de edad quienes tiene a cargo y estudian. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y zapatos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad la cual ha sido de mucho beneficio. Comercializa sus productos de manera ambulante. Solicita el crédito para comprar: zapatos, perfumes, maquillaje, cremas, entre otros con el fin de establecer a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Paublina is from the city of Managua, a mother of two children who are minors in school and whom she has in her care. She is a trade merchant and makes her living selling cosmetics and shoes. She has been doing this activity for three years and it has been very beneficial. She sells her products in the street. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy: shoes, perfumes, makeup, creams among other things with the goal of establishing her customers and growing her income. Her goal is to make her business grow and in the future buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes, makeup, and creams, among other things.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for more than six years now. This is the source of his income. 

Nelson is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, etc.

loans.name: Rodelo

texts.en:
Rodelo earns a living through his food vending business . He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has been in the business for more than two years now.

Rodelo is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, cassava, sugar, cooking oil and others. With this, he will be able to cook more snacks and sell them,  thus augmenting his income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, cassava, sugar, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. Zenaida hopes to expand her farming venture in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Maria Reina Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria de  37 años  es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, es una persona  muy trabajadora responsable  pues día a día  se esmera  por su trabajo el cual  consiste en venta de repuestos  y reparación de bicicletas desde hace 10 años con la ayuda de su hijo mayor decidieron poner el negocio y  es de esta manera como ella  ha suplido las necesidades  de sus 4 hijos siendo una mujer muy esforzada , María  solicita un crédito  con la intención  de reparar la galera y comprar los materia como tablas, laminas, clavos, etc en la cual repara las bicicletas  y además  poder comprar  más repuestos y así darle  un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejor su  calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Thirty-seven year old Maria is a single mother who lives in her own home with her four children. She is a hardworking and responsible person. 

She gives her best every day in her work, which consists of repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. Ten years ago, she and her eldest son decided to start a business and this is how she has provided for the needs of her four children. She is a very hardworking woman. 

Maria requests a loan to repair the shop where she repairs bicycles, buy materials like power tools, sheet metal, nails, etc., and also to buy more spare parts. 

This will enable her to offer better service to her customers and to improve her and her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy power tools, sheet metal, nails and spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es: Alexander, es un padre de familia responsable que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus dos hijos de las edades de seis y uno de dos meses de nacida, junto con su esposa manejan un negocio familiar de venta de pacas de ropa. Actualmente está trabajando solo, debido a que su esposa se está recuperando de una complicación sufrida en el parto. Don Alexander solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de pacas de pantalones, zapatos y camisas para vender y mantener activo su negocio ya que de los ingresos que este le genera puede cubrir gastos de alimentación, educación y salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander's a responsible father who's concerned with the welfare of his two children, ages 6 and 2 months.

He and his wife manage a family business selling bundles of clothing.  Currently he works alone because his wife is recuperating from complications from childbirth.

Alexander's requesting the loan to invest in buying bundles of pants, shoes, and shirts to sell and keep his business going.  His business generates the income to cover his family's food, education, and health expenses.

loans.use: to buy bundles of pants, shoes, and shirts

loans.name: Leny Patricia

texts.es: Doña Leny de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia junto a su hijo, su hermano y su madre, ella se dedica al a venta de comida desde hace 10 años es una persona responsable honesta y muy trabadora con ganas de sacar adelante a su familia su negocio tiene muy buen, margen de ganancias gracias a la demanda que ha logrado hasta a ahora, ella solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando los ingredientes para preparar los alimentos como: pollos, carnes, verduras, frutas, maíz, frijoles, arroz, etc. y a si dar cumplimiento a la demanda para poder obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leny, 38 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her child, her brother and her mother.  She has worked selling food for 10 years.  She is a responsible, honest and very hardworking person who is eager to get ahead with her family.  Her business has a very good  profit margin thanks to the demand that she has achieved up to now.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business buying the ingredients to prepare food like:  chicken, meat, vegetables, fruits, corn, beans, rice, etc. and to fulfill the demand in order to be able to obtain higher profits and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, fruits, corn, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 60-years-old, married and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Estelita has a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, can goods and chips.

Estelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, can goods and chips.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 41-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father of five children; two sons and three daughters. 

Adham works as an employee in the morning but with a very low wage, so he works also as a blacksmith after his work. This will enable him to pay all the necessary expenses for his family. His workshop has been opened for two years.
 
Adham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials like iron for his workshop. This will make him able to meet all the customer demand, especially in the summer season. Adham's income will increase. 

Adham appears in the photo while he was in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy more materials like iron for his workshop.

loans.name: Abdeljabbar

texts.en:
Abdel jabbar is a 26-year-old single man from Jenin. He lives in a simple house in the city with his family. 

Abdeljabbar works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This income barely covers the family's needs. One year ago, Abdeljabbar opened a small clothes store for women in the city. It is a good business but needs a lot of improvement. Because it is Eid season, he needs some money to buy more stock.

Abdeljabbar took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more stock for his store to resell. This will increase his earnings.
 
Abdeljabbar appears in the photo in front of his store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for his store to resell.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the farming business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income.

Marisa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. Marisa hopes to expand her farming venture in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the business for more than 13 years now.

Ruben is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a tricycad business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years.

Josephine has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts for her tricycad.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the repair of her tricycad

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Lyra has been in this business for two years. Lyra earns additional income from selling purified water.

Lyra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Marinisa

texts.en:
Marinisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish for her dried fish-making business.

Marinisa has been in this business for four years. Marinisa earns additional income from food vending.

Marinisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her dried fish-making business.

loans.name: Anasetasia

texts.en:
Anasetasia is 24 years old and married with two children. She has a shop selling everyday use products. 

She has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, sugar, soy sauce, flour, noodles, snacks, ice cream, soft drinks and a bag of rice. 

Anasetasia will use her profits to extend and improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sugar, soy sauce, flour, noodles, snacks, ice cream, soft drinks and a bag of rice.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita, 56, is married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. 

Julita has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional household supplies to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, soap and shampoo.

In the future, Julita would like to build and further expand her business to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household supplies to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie, 29, is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines for five years and earns additional income selling coconut wine.

Leslie has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Before this loan, Leslie borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and further expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nora is 40 years old and has one child who is in school.

Nora has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish.

Nora has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina works hard to support her family. Rubina is single and has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines.

Rubina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Rubina has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Rubina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Angielyn

texts.en:
Angielyn is 39 years old and married with two children.

Angielyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, juices, etc..

Angielyn has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Angielyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods and juices.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, sugar, noodles, eggs, spices, etc. in her general store business.

Jennylyn has been in this business for six years. Jennylyn earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loading.

Jennylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, sugar, noodles, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita, 64, is widowed with six children. She wants to start a small business of making and selling popcorn in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of corn, dripping oil, salt, plastic bags and a frying pan. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development in 2011 to gain access to financial services. In the future, Makerita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, dripping oil, salt, plastic bags and a frying pan

loans.name: Mehry

texts.ru: Мехри 38 лет. Она добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Мехри вместе со своей семьей живет на северной части Таджикистана. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Дети не совершеннолетние и учатся в средней школе. Муж Мехри трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она более 10 лет преподает в средней школе. Мехри является одной из успешных учителей, которая внесла большой вклад в сфере образования. Она должна купить школьные формы и школьные принадлежности как книги, тетради, сумки и т.п. для своих детей, так как скоро начнется новый учебный год. Ее муж не отправил деньги, и поэтому Мехри обратилась за займом в сумме 3000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mehry is 38 years old.  She is a kind and goal-oriented woman.  She is married and has four children. She and her family live in northern Tajikistan.  The children are all still minors and are in secondary school.  Mehry's husband is a migrant worker in Russia.  Mehry herself has been a secondary school teacher for over 10 years.  She is one of those successful teachers who has made a great contribution to the field of teaching.  

Since the new school year will start soon, Mehry needs to buy school uniforms and school supplies such as books, notebooks, backpacks, etc. for her children.  Since her husband hasn't sent her any money, she has applied for a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS).  She is relying on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and school supplies for her children for the new school year

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, 53, is married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 16 years and earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.

Elsie is borrowing 27,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN LUIS”  iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller electrónico, venta de productos de belleza, brostería, tienda de abarrotes, venta de vidrios, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, costura de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que esta actividad la aprendieron de su madre, ya que ella apoyaba en el negocio familia, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la orientación de las asesoras de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank group “SAN LUIS” is starting its 29th loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Central Focus of Collpani. This group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Vicenta is the treasurer. The businesses owned by these group members are diverse and include repairing electronics, selling beauty products, running a grocery store, selling glasswares, selling clothing, selling blankets, and sewing sweaters.

This loan will benefit the small business owners who are members of Vicenta's group. Vicenta reports that she has been involved with Pro Mujer for 18 months. She joined at the invitation of a friend who was already a member. Currently, Vicenta runs her own fruit stand. She learned this trade from working alongside her mother in the family business before she decided to open her own fruit stand.
 
She will use this loan to increase her capital (to buy fruit). She will buy the fruit at wholesale to later sell at her fruit stand. This form of work allows Vicenta to generate resources for her family. She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the orientation from credit advisors.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.ru: Фазила порядочная женщина. Ей 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж работает учителем в средней школе. Фазила работает уборщицей в частной хирургической клинике. Она уже работает более 4 лет. Фазила всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее старший сын Хуршед, успешно окончил среднюю школу.  Он поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Фазила должна оплатить за учебный договор сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Fazila is a clean-living woman of 44 years of age.  She is married and is raising two children.  Her husband is a secondary school teacher.  Fazila is a cleaning woman in a private surgical clinic.  She has been working for four years.  It has always been Fazila's dream that her children would get higher educations.  Her eldest son Hurshed has successfully completed his secondary education and was accepted to the Khujand State University.  

Fazila must pay his tuition, but has no money.  She is requesting a loan to pay her son's university tuition.  She is relying on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive en casa de un familiar junto a su hermano, ella posee una tienda desde hace 3 años, gracias a su amabilidad y honestidad se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes de los cuales ya posee gran demanda de esta manera a logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, la clienta  solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de detergentes, granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, etc. para surtir su tienda y a si satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hermano.
texts.en:
The client lives in a family member's home with her brother. She has had a shop for 3 years; thanks to her friendliness and honesty, she has gained the trust of her clients, from whom she already gets a lot of business. This way, she has managed to cover many of her costs. 

The client is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of detergents, basic grains, drinks, candy, etc. to stock her shop, and thus satisfy the demands of her clients, increase her income, and improve her quality of life and that of her brother.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, basic grains, drinks, candy, etc.

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru:
Назар житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 51 год. У него есть жена и сын. Назар занимается сельским хозяйством. Он хочет иметь дополнительный источник дохода, чтобы улучшить условия проживания. Назар планирует открыть овцеводческий бизнес. Разведение овец не требует больших вложений, это наименее хлопотное хозяйство. Для овец не нужно покупать специальных кормов, им достаточно травы с пастбищ. Кроме того им не страшны зимние морозы и различные инфекционные заболевания. Именно поэтому Назар выбрал этот бизнес. 
Назар при дворе дома имеет сарай для содержания овец, а также корм для овец. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить трех голов овец и начать бизнес. Полученную прибыль он хочет потратить на обучение сына.
texts.en:
Nazar is 51 years old and lives in the J. Rumi region.  He has a wife and son.  Nazar is a farmer.  He wants to have a source of additional income in order to improve their living conditions.  Nazar is planning to open a business in sheep breeding.  Raising sheep doesn't require a large investment and it's the least troublesome buisness.  You don't need to buy special feed for sheep.  All they need is grass from the pasture.  Besides this, the winter's cold and infectious diseases don't affect them.  Nazar chose this business precisely for these reasons.

Nazar has a barn for keeping the sheep and he has fodder for them. He is requesting a loan in order to buy three head of sheep to start his business.  He wants to spent the profit he makes on his son's education.

loans.use: to buy three head of sheep to start a business and to use the profit for his son's education

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Concepcion Group

texts.es: Duo Solidario concepción, está formado por doña María luisa de 47 años quien es viuda ella vive con su hijo y su nuera o sea la esposa de su hijo, doña Maria posee una tortillería y cuenta con 2 empleadas que le ayudan a elaborar las tortillas, el negocio esta ubicado en la calle real de ciudad vieja. ella solicita su crédito para poder comprar insumos como (maíz, leña) y lograr  ahorrar comprando por mayor ya que tiene demanda de sus clientes, su sueño es lograr poder mejorar su negocio y tener una venta de comida ya que se lo solicitan sus clientes,y también tener otra tortillería y con esto poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Doña María Luisa, 47 years old, is part of Duo Solidario Concepción. She is a widow, and lives with her son and her daughter-in-law, her son's wife. Doña María has a tortilla-making business with 2 employees who help her make the tortillas. The business is located on Calle Real in the Old City. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase inputs such as corn and firewood and save money by buying wholesale, as she has a lot of demand from her customers. Her dream is to be able to improve her business and sell other kinds of food, as her customers request, and also have another tortilla stall, and with this be able to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Eva Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Eva, en la actualidad es viuda, madre soltera, quien ha perdido a su esposo con quien trabajaba en conjunto en el negocio de la fotografía a lo que se dedica hoy en día. Pero la vida sigue, ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar una cámara fotografica profesional, ya que fue víctima de robo y perdió la que tenia, por que para ella es muy importante reponerla ya que esta es la herramienta principal para ganarse la vida a diario y así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Eva is a widow and single mother. She lost her husband with whom she worked together in the photography business, the business she is still involved in. Life goes on, she is requesting this loan to buy a professional photographic camera. She was the victim of a robbery and lost the camera she had. It is very important to replace it as it is the main tool she has to earn her daily bread and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a professional photographic camera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs for fattening

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru: Момагул 58-летняя вдова, проживает в городе Вахдат. У нее трое сыновей и одна дочь. Сыновья Момагул женаты и живут со своими семьями у матери. Последние три года Момагул и ее одна невестка занимаются шитьем. Они в основном на заказ шьют женские национальные платья и за день вышивают по два обычных платьев и платьев с вышивками. Сейчас Момагул собирается расширить свое швейное дело. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить новую компьютерную швейную машинку для своей второй невестки и таким образом увеличить производительность труда. Момагул полученную прибыль с деятельности будет откладывать на приобретение земли для последующей постройки дома своим сыновьям.
texts.en:
Momagul is a 58 year old widow who lives in Vahdat.  She has three sons and one daughter.  Momagul's sons are all married and they and their families all live with Momagul.  For the last three years Momagul and one of her daughters-in-law have been in the sewing business.  Primarily they sew traditional women's dresses to order.  In a day they sew two ordinary dresses and embroidered dresses.

Now Momagul is preparing to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy a new, computerized sewing machine for another daughter-in-law, thereby increasing their productivity of labor.  Momagul will save up the additional profits in order to buy land for the subsequent construction of a house for her sons.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de sus 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Hermelinda se dedica a la agricultura y posee unas héctareas que adquirió con el apoyo de sus padres, el cual es su principal sustento para su hogar. Lleva casi 7 años sembrando cacao orgánico y este producto es el principal sustento de muchos hogares en su región. Tiene pensado adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para ampliar sus plantaciones y en efecto incrementar sus ingresos económicos en beneficio de sus hijos a quienes espera apoyar hasta convertirlos en buenos profesionales. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, age 26, is a single mother of three children with whom she lives in her adobe house. Hermelinda works in agriculture and owns some hectares that she got with the support of her parents. This is the primary means of support for her home. For almost 7 years she has been planting organic cacao. This product is the primary means of sustenance of many homes in the region. She has the intention to acquire additional fields to grow her farm and, in effect, to increase her income in order to benefit her children, as she hopes to support them as they become professionals.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She is committed to making her payments in a punctual manner. At this point in time, she wants to borrow 1,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of organic fertilizer and thus nourish her sown fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her sown fields.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es: Aura es una señora emprendedora, es madre soltera que trabaja diariamente vendiendo comida en su casa de habitación. Con mucho sacrificio obtuvo su casa de habitación, la cual desea mejorar a través de un financiamiento. Solicita el apoyo de crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques y hierro para levantar las paredes divisorias en el interior de la casa que le permita mayor seguridad y privacidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Aura is an enterprising woman. She is a single mother who works daily selling food from her home. With much sacrifice she was able to obtain her house, which she wants to improve with funding. She is requesting the support of a loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, and iron to raise the dividing walls inside the house, which will give her more security and privacy in her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, and iron

loans.name: 5 De Junio Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 5 DE JUNIO,  Está  compuesto por diez integrantes todas  mujeres,   la presidenta  del banco es la Sra. Marisol   tiene 42 años tiene cuatro hijos,  ella se dedica  a la   venta  de variedad de Calzados, para niños, tiene su puesto de venta en una feria muy concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, la Sra. Marisol va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de calzados de cuero por mayor y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Marisol va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de mercadería,    es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The 5 de Junio communal bank is composed of ten members, all women. The president of the bank is Señora Marisol, 42 years old with four children. She sells a variety of footwear for children, and her stall is located in a very crowded market in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first within the institution. 

Señora Marisol will use this loan to purchase leather shoes in bulk, and thus offer more variety to her customers. Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business, and Señora Marisol will use the benefits to purchase a variety of merchandise. She is a very hard-working person, and she feels happy for the opportunity provided to her and the other members of the group.

loans.use: to purchase children's shoes in bulk

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing taro in a plantation to earn a living. Kalameli has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, a pick, a file, chemicals, a water gallon jug and a chainsaw. She joined SPBD in 2011. Kalameli will spend her profits to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a pick, a file, chemicals, a water gallon jug and a chainsaw

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon es un hombre de 40 años casado, está casado con Claudia con quien tiene 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa construida a base de adobe. Jhon se dedica a la agricultura por esta razón tiene 5 héctareas de terreno en donde siembra cacao orgánico, barbasco y árboles frutales. Comenta que fue fácil iniciarse de manera independiente ya que tenía los conocimientos necesarios en este campo porque desde muy niño apoyaba a sus padres en las distintas tareas agrícolas. Su trabajo consiste en tratar de brindarle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones para obtener un buen producto. A nivel de sus terrenos posee más plantaciones de cacao porque es usado para la fabricación de chocolates, es por ello que trata de fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico para asi tener cultivos mucho más ricos. Su principal objetivo es comprar otro terreno en donde espera incrementar sus plantaciones de barbasco. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera ùntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar y realizar el mantenimiento respectivo a sus plantaciones de cacao tales como el corte tallos defectuosos y retiro de maleza.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 40-year-old married man. He is married to Claudia, with whom he has 3 children; they live together in their adobe house. Jhon works in agriculture, and he has 5 hectares of land where he plants organic cacao, barbasco (a plant used in fishing), and fruit trees. He says that it was easy to get started independently because he had the necessary knowledge in this field; from a very young age, he helped his parents do various agricultural tasks. 

His work involves trying to maintain his plantations adequately to obtain good products. In terms of his land, he has more cacao plantations because it is used to make chocolate; for that reason he tries to fertilize his land with organic fertilizer, to produce much better tasting crops. His main objective is to purchase more land where he hopes to increase his barbasco plantations. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support he receives to get ahead. He is also committed to making his payments on time. He would like to have 2,000 Nuevo Soles to hire local workers and perform the maintenance needed for his cacao plantations, such as cutting bad stems and removing weeds.

loans.use: to hire local workers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Vilma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria habita en Malambo, un municipio área metropolitana de Barranquilla, con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 13 a 23 años. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de mercancía, siendo sus principales productos las cremas y perfumes, que vende de contado y a crédito, de acuerdo a las características de cada cliente. Ella desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, se dedica a su negocio, porque tiene como principal meta aumentar las ventas, para incrementar el bienestar de su familia. Aunque su mayor desafío,  ha sido lograr fuentes de financiación confiables y a bajo costo, ha encontrado la posibilidad con su credikiva para incrementar sus compras y hacerlas de contado, pues las ha estado haciendo a crédito en la última temporada. Su sueño desde que inició su negocio ha sido apoyar a su cónyuge, en dar respuesta a los gastos de su hogar, mediante esta actividad mercantil, en la que ha logrado acceder a 3 tipos de guías especializadas de productos, con las que ha ampliado su oferta de mercancías y logrado su mayor sueño, que es el aumento del bienestar familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará perfumes, cremas, ropa casual y deportiva, con la que aumentará sus inventario y podrá servir mucho mejor a su clientela para obtener mayores utilidades en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Malambo, a metropolitan municipal area in Barranquilla.  She lives with her family which consists of her spouse and her 3 children between the ages of 13 and 23 years. Since she was 12 years old, she has worked as a merchant, the main goods being creams and perfumes.  These are sold in cash or credit, depending on the characteristics of the customer.  

From 8 in the morning until 8 at night, she works in her business, because her main goal is to increase sales, to better her family's lifestyle.  Although, her biggest challenge has been reliable funding sources and receiving it at a low cost.  She has found this possibility with the Kiva credit, to increase her purchases and make them cash based, because she had them based on credit for the last season. 

Her dream since she began her business has been to support her spouse, in response to the household expenses, by using this commercial activity.  Through her sales, she has gained access to 3 specialized products, with which she has expanded the good she can offer and achieve her biggest dream, to better her family's lifestyle.  

She is currently applying for a Kiva credit, first financed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that will help her to buy perfumes, creams, casual and active clothing.  With this, she can increase her inventory and could better serve her customers to make higher profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, casual and active clothing

loans.name: Avasa

texts.en: Avasa is 21 years old.  She is married and has one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling Ice Cake in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of sugar, cordial, foam cups, spoons, filters and cooler. In the future, Avasa hopes to improve her family's standard of living.  She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, cordial , foam cups, spoons , filter and cooler

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.
Najla is a 19 year-old single woman from Beit Hanoun near Jabalia city. Her father is a construction worker with a low wage. This is the only source of income for the family. Najla graduated from the high school with very good marks and she will go to university to study what she wants. Her father would like to buy a laptop for her to help her to do her homework and reports. Najla took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of purchasing a new laptop for her study.

loans.use: to pay the costs of purchasing a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en: Emelinda is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for several years now, together with her husband.  Emelinda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling Natasha products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her direct selling Natasha products business.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from Natasha to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more daily-use items like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Melanie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more daily-use items like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a 'buy and sell' dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell. Vicenta has been in this business for 23 years. Shesearns more income from raising pigs.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mayleen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children who are in school, Mayleen works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mayleen is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and frozen products to sell for her frozen products business.

Mayleen has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and frozen products to sell

loans.name: Edilberto Gustavo

texts.es: Edilberto toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, pues nació y creció allí, aprendiendo las labores agrícolas, pues su padre siempre fue agricultor. Actualmente posee cultivos de maíz, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en el mercado del pueblo donde reside; de esta manera obtiene ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. El prestatario es un hombre pujante, activo, emprendedor y tiene muchas ganas de progresar; eso lo motiva solicitar el segundo ciclo de crédito, con el único fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, larvicidas) para continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha con productos de muy buena calidad que le permita venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado y así, aumentar el margen de ganancia por ventas; dándole la posibilidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida y avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo que es adquirir su propio terreno para tener sus cultivos y poder garantizar y disfrutar con su esposa, una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Edilberto has spent all of his life in the countryside. He was born and grew up there, learning agricultural work, as his father was always a farmer. Currently he has corn crops, which are harvested and sold in the village market where he lives. This way, he earns income to cover the basic needs of his family. 

The borrower is a vigorous, active, enterprising man and he has a great desire to get ahead; this motivates him to request a second cycle of credit, with the single purpose of investing it in the purchase of agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer, pesticide, larvicide). This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and reap a very good-quality harvest that can be sold at a better price in the market, and thus increase his profit margin and allow him and his wife to enjoy better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer, pesticide, larvicide)

loans.name: Puro Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PURO AMOR”  iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alexandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de condimentos, tienda de barrio, venta de frescos, venta de películas, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alexandra es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artefactos electrónicos; este negocio lo aprendió al observar la demanda de estos productos y decidió emprenderlo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de artefactos electrónicos) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “PURO AMOR” Group communal bank is in their tenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors. Alexandra is the President. The businesses of the members vary, amongst them are: food sales, the sale of condiments, a neighborhood store, the sale of iced drinks (frescos), movie sales and selling meat.

This loan will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs including Alexandra. She says she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago on the invitation of her mother who is a member of the institution. At present she has a business selling electronics. She started this business by observing the demand for this product and decided to attempt it.

Alexandra will use this loan to increase her capital (buying electronic goods) which she will buy from wholesalers and later retail in her selling place. Working in this way she can generate the income to support her family, as she lives with her life partner and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Alexandra replied that she enjoyed the health and loan training.

loans.use: to buy electronic goods.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 29 años, está casada con Eulogio y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Paulina se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico y achiote. Desde niña apoyo a sus padres en labores menores siendo está la actividad agrícola el principal sustento económico para su familia. Cuando cumplió 20 años se comprometió con Eulogio quien heredo unos terrenos de parte de sus padres, inicio una vida llena de objetivos por cumplir logrando concretar la compra de otra parcela adicional como producto de sus primeros años de trabajo en pareja. Para un normal desempeño de las tareas agrícolas cuyo fin es obtener almendras de cacao en buen estado para su comercialización. Para realizar todas las tareas debe de contar con capital de trabajo ya sea para contratar trabajadores del lugar o la compra de abono orgánico. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea solicitar 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y así nutrir a sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 29 years old, married to Eulogio, and has 4 children who live with her in her adobe built house.  She works producing organic cacao and achiote.  Since she was a young girl, she helped her parents with menial labor, but farming was the main economic livelihood for her family.  

When she turned 20, she was engaged to Eulogio who inherited some land on the part of her parents.  She began a life with the goals of purchasing another parcel of land as a product of her first years of work with her partner.  

For a normal performance of agricultural work, they intend to obtain cocoa beans in good condition for sale.  To perform all the tasks, they should have working capital either to hire workers for the place, or to purchase organic fertilizer.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to move forward.  They also commit themselves to pay the loan back in a timely manner. In this loan, she requests 2,000 new soles for the purchase of organic fertilizer to nurture their crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Merizol

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Merizol works hard to support her family.

She has a fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Merizol is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish business.

Merizol has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mema

texts.en: Mema is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has four children. She has a small business, a taro and banana plantation. She is applying for this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Mema will use the loan to buy iron roofing, timber, cement and nails. Mema joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy iron roofing, timber, cement and nails to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Nora Lokule

texts.en: Nora is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. She is a married mother of four children, two of whom go to school. Nora heard about Finance Sudan Limited through marketing and promotions. She is a businesswoman who operates a shop that sells mixed items, including sodas, beer, sugar, rice and many other items. She is borrowing 2,000 SSP (South Sudanese Pounds). She wants to use the money to buy more stock for her shop. Nora's main challenges include escalating exchange rates and transportation problems. This loan will help her pay for school fees for her children, medication and food.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, rice and other mixed items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Sylvia has been fattening pigs for a year, and she earns additional income from selling vegetables. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en: Rodilyn is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Rodilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional jewelry to sell. Rodilyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling jewelry for four years, and she also earns income from selling pre-paid mobile phone loads. Rodilyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Tuamasaga

texts.en: Tuamasaga is a 53-year- woman who is married and has seven children. She has a small business, selling drinks and snacks to members of her community. Tuamasaga is applying for a loan to help her pay for a child's university fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy a cooler, noodles, snacks and sugar. Tuamasaga joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for a child's university fees and to buy a cooler, noodles, snacks and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, two of whom are in school, Rosemary works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosemary is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. Rosemary has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. Leonila has been in this business for nine years. Leonila earns additional income from growing and selling vegetables. Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Mahuena Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUENA est composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. Gaston  (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo), est le représente du groupe. Gaston est âgé de 51 ans. Gaston est marié à Séraphine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Gaston vit avec sa femme et ces enfants. Les charges de la famille sont assurées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Gaston vend depuis dix des cartes de recharges à son domicile. Gaston s'approvisionne chez les grossiste de sa zone. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Gaston s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUENA pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group called Mahuena is made up of three persons who live in the same district. Gaston (the one who has his hand raised in the photo) is the representative of the group. 

Gaston is 51. He is married to  Séraphine. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and in their care. Gaston lives with his wife and children. The couple share in covering household expenses. For this reason Gaston has been selling rechargeable phone cards for 10 years out of his home. He buys his stock from a wholesaler in his area. Wishing to expand his activity, Gaston came together with the other members of the Mahuena group to request a fourth loan from  ALIDé. The prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 49 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom are in school. Beatriz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, including canned goods, soap, shampoo and spices. Beatriz has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year, and she earns additional income from rice retailing. Beatriz aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store, including canned goods, soap, shampoo and spices.

loans.name: Senayda Aluri

texts.es:
Senayda, tiene 31 años, es soltera, vive junto a su mamá, persona que se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Senayda, por su parte trabaja como asesora de ventas en una tienda de telas y ropas, es su primer empleo y posee  mas de tres años de trabajar para ellos.

El préstamo será invertido en gastos para realizar la celebración de su ceremonia de matrimonio. Su deseo es unir su vida con su futuro esposo. Con un solo propósito de luchar, construir su propia casa, trabajar juntos para formar una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Senayda is 31 years old and single. She lives with her mother who is employed as a domestic worker. Senayda for her part, works as a sales person in a clothing and fabric store. It is her first job and she has been working there for more than three years. 

This loan will be used to cover the expenses of her wedding ceremony. Her wish is to spend her life together with her future husband, with the purpose of struggling, building their own house and working together to form a beautiful family.

loans.use: to pay for her wedding ceremony.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 49 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades d e 18 a 25 años. Maria realiza una actividad comercial, para generar ingresos que apoyen el sustento de su hogar, vendiendo ropa femenina y masculina, desde hace 5 años. Como contadora pública- profesional, Maria maneja muy bien su negocio y su iniciativa surgió con el fin de generar  ingresos que apoyaran una educación de calidad para sus hijos.  Por eso una vez dejó de ser empleada, tomó el dinero producto de su liquidación y un aporte de su padre,  y empezó a generar sus ingresos autónomos,  invirtiéndolo en mercancías y vendiéndolas entre sus compañeras de trabajo y referidos por estos. Los productos de su oferta, son los shores, jeans, blusas, camisas, bermudas, que vende a crédito y de contado a una clientela, que ha construido poco a poco. Ella hace sus compras en al ciudad de Medellín, donde están ubicadas las principales industrias textiles y en el departamento del Atlántico cuando hay ofertas a las que no se puede negar, pues le gana un poco mas a sus productos.  Su meta mas adelante es adquirir un local propio y su mayor desafío es mantenerse en el centro comercial, donde existe mucha competencia. Por eso trabaja de lunes a Domingo, con el fin de genera mucha mas utilidad y asegurar un mayor bienestar familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestidos para damas y caballeros, deportivos y casuales. Su inversión ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo y a renovar la mercancía que mantiene en exhibición, para atraer a su clientela y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, lives in the city of Barranquilla, with her spouse and has 3 children between the ages of 18 and 25.  Maria works in commercial activity, to generate income that help sustain her home.  She has been selling feminine and masculine clothing for 5 years. 

As a certified professional public accountant, Maria manages her business very well and her initiative arose in order to generate income to support a quality education for her children.  Once she ceased to be employed, she took the money from her settlement and a contribution from her father, and began to create her independent income.  She invested in commodities and sold them among her co-workers and by being referred by them.

The products that she offers are jeans, blouses, shirts, bermuda shorts, etc. selling on credit and cash to a customer base that has built slowly. She makes purchases in the city of Medellin, where the main textile industries are located, and in the Department of the Atlantic when there are offers that cannot be denied, because she earns a little more with their products. Her biggest goal is to acquire her own place and her biggest challenge is to exist in the mall where there is a lot of competition. Because of this, she works Monday to Sunday in order to generate more profit and ensure better family welfare. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, first financed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy casual and active clothing for men and women.   Her investment will help to increase her working capital and renew the merchandise that she keeps on display.  It will attract customers, and this is precisely the success of your investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and men, active and casual wear.

loans.name: Aso

texts.en: Aso is a 38-year-married woman with three children. She would like to start growing taro to earn a living. Aso has applied for a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, a wheelbarrow and a digging bar. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Aso will use her profits to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and a digging bar, in order to start growing taro for a living.

loans.name: Oluwatogni Group

texts.fr: OLUWATOGNI est un groupe de deux personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Assiatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Assiatou est mariée à Issiaka. Le couple à un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Assiatou vit avec son enfant. Assiatou et son mari assurent ensemble les charges du ménage.
