texts.en: Tepatasi is a 25-year-old single woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tepatasi has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Tepatasi hopes to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leata

texts.en: Leata is a 31-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells pancakes, scones, muffins, etc. in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Leata needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, eggs, yeast, butter, cooking oil and an oven. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Leata has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, yeast, butter, cooking oil and an oven.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La Señora María vive en  el cantón de Paute lugar que tiene un clima privilegiado, sus tierras son fértiles en donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores y una gran variedad de frutos, existen varios comercios sobre todo para disfrutar de la gastronomía, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 47 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 23, 22, 20, 19 y 4 años, 4 de sus hijos son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan economícamente, a mas de trabajar tres de ellos cursan los estudios universitario. Su esposo labora de albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la agricultura y cría de pollos y ganado, se encuentra trabajando desde muy joven ya que sus padres le enseñaron esta actividad. 

 Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de pollos de los cuales obtuvo buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito para comprar pollos y alimento para un chanchos. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad que existe entre todas las socias.
texts.en:
María lives in the canton of Paute which has a warm climate and fertile soil where beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruit are grown.  There are several businesses here where one can enjoy the local cuisine.  Its people are friendly, kind and still maintain their culture and traditions.

María, 47, is married and has five children, ages 23, 22, 20, 19 and 4.  The oldest ones work and help out financially.  Three of them attend the university.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and they live in their own home.

María works in agriculture and raises chickens and pigs.  Her parents taught her the trade when she was very young and she has been working ever since.

She used her previous loan to buy chickens and was able to make a considerable profit.  She is requesting a new loan to buy chickens and pig feed.  She likes her communal bank because of the solidarity among all of its members.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pig feed.

loans.name: Agostinha

texts.en: Agostinha is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married, and she has one child. She is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as bags for kids, school bags for kids, kids' shoes, shoes for women as well as men, hats and so on. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Agostinha is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy bags for kids, school bags for kids, kids' shoes, shoes for women as well as men, hats and so on.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. She is a woman living in a house with her ​​family and lived with her ​​women to own animals like horses, buffaloes, cows, and goats. 

She is running a business in front of her house by selling hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, coca-cola, sprite, sagiko), body lotion, cigarettes, eggs, books, pencils, salt, coffee, sugar, milk and water. She is making a good income from selling palm wine and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, body lotion, cigarettes, eggs, books, pencils, salt, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 22-year-old single woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Maria has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, fertilizer, bush knives, barbed wire and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Maria hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, fertilizer, bush knives, barbed wire and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Vaila

texts.en: Vaila is a 22-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Vaila has requested a loan to buy taro roots, chemicals, bush knives, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow and pick. She has joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her profits, Vaila hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, chemicals, bush knives, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow and pick.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 20 years old and has been together with her partner for 3 years with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Gloria has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, frying pan, and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Gloria will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, frying pan, and plastic bags

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 19 years old and married with no children. She runs a small business selling banana chips in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Ana has requested a loan to buy an oven, large basin, dripping oil, sack of raw bananas, and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ana hopes to extend her business to other nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy an oven, large basin, dripping oil, sack of raw bananas, and plastic bags

loans.name: Ermina

texts.en: Ermina is taking out a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, salt, body lotion, milk, eggs, water, fish, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, noodles and pencils.She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $500. Ermina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a teacher. She is going to own a garden for planting things like papayas, vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, salt, body lotion, milk eggs, water, fish, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite,Sagiko,beer, noodles and pencils.

loans.name: Toefiliga

texts.en:
Toefiliga is a 30-year-old woman. She has lived with her partner for 3 years, with 5 children.

She has a small garden where she grows tomatos, cucumbers, pumpkins and cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Toefiliga needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, gloves, fertilizer, a garden hose and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Toefiliga will use the profits from her sales to build a green house for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy seeds, sprayers, gloves, fertilizer, a garden hose and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Virgen De  Bronce  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Virgen de Bronce está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva a sus visitantes. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas luchadoras y amables que viven el día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica y brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jessica, tiene 19 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de una tía pero de forma independiente.

Doña Jessica se dedica al comercio de ropa, perfumes y cosméticos de diferentes marcas, lleva en esta actividad desde hace 3 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo ya que ofrece sus productos a sus clientes puerta a puerta. Ella también está estudiando para terminar sus estudios del colegio. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa para así continuar creciendo en este negocio.
texts.en:
The "Virgen de Bronce" communal bank is made up of seven women who live in a beautiful neighborhood in Cuenca. This city was recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in December 1999. Four rivers run through the city and there are many places where one can enjoy nature. The diverse gastronomy captivates the city's visitors. Its people, like these members, are friendly people who fight every day to improve their financial stability and give their children a better future. They still keep the culture and traditions of their people alive.

One of the members of this group is Jessica, 19. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 5. Her husband works as a private employee. They don't have their own house, so they live independently in an aunt's house.

Jessica makes a living selling clothing, perfume, and cosmetics from various brands. She has been in this business for three years. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule, since she sells her products door-to-door. She is also studying to finish her high school degree.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Silaumea

texts.en: Silaumea is 32 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Silaumea has requested a loan to buy a deep freezer, cordials, sugar, a cooler, plastic bags and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Silaumea will help with her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, cordials, sugar, a cooler, plastic bags and foam cups.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 21-year-old woman who is single with 1 child. She runs a business selling twist ties, rice, sugar, flour etc. in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Florence has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, rice, sugar, herring, noodles, salt, twist ties, mosquito coils and cigarettes. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, rice, sugar, herring, noodles, salt, twist ties, mosquito coils and cigarettes.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Catalina lives with her family in the town of CPG, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 13 years now.

Catalina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages. With this loan, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Catalina has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is a 29-year-old married woman from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She and her husband help each other grow rice on a small plot of land. However, their land does not produce enough to feed their two children, so she and her spouse, apart from farming activities, are involved in the garment and construction industries to fulfill their daily needs.

Run had had three loans already, which caused positive changes to her family’s economy. To continue improving their family, she is asking for a loan to buy construction equipment to enhance her husband’s quality of performance by having enough tools. 

She is happy and thankful for the loan granted to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction equipment to enhance her husband’s quality of performance by having enough construction tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his delivery truck.

loans.name: Andrea Paulina

texts.es:
La Señorita Andrea forma parte desde hace algún tiempo del grupo de crédito Pauteñitas, vive en el cantón de Paute lugar que tiene un clima privilegiado, sus tierras son fértiles en donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores y una gran variedad de frutos, existen varios comercios sobre todo para disfrutar de la gastronomía, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señorita Andrea tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 7 meses de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, su padre es jardinero y su madre ama de casa, la casa en la que viven es de sus padres.

Ella se dedica al cuidado de su hija y de su casa  pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar cría cuyes a los que los que vende en su cantón, le gusta porque es un buen trabajo al mismo tiempo que pasa en casa. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de pollos, cuyes y en su alimento para sus animales de los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que quiere comprar más cuyes y materiales de construcción para hacer un galpón más grande para tener más cuyes. 

Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión y solidaridad que existe entre todas las socias.
texts.en:
Andrea has been a member of the communal bank "Pauteñitas" for some time.  She lives in the canton of Paute which has a warm climate and fertile land where beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruits are grown.  There are several businesses, especially those where one can enjoy the local cuisine.  Its people still preserve their culture and traditions.

Andrea is 19 years old.  She is a single mother of a 7-month-old girl and lives in her parents' home.  Her father is a gardener and her mother is a homemaker.  

She cares for her daughter and the home but in order to contribute to the household economy, raises guinea pigs and sells them in the canton.  She enjoys her work because it allows her to spend time at home.

Andrea used her previous loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed, which gave her a very good profit.  She is requesting a new loan to buy more guinea pigs and construction materials to build a bigger pen for them.

Andrea likes her communal bank because of the solidarity and support among all the members.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and construction materials.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
A loan of 600 USD is offered to Amelia to improve her business. She is married, and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, body lotion, coffee, salt, Fanta, fish, oil, cigarettes and biscuits. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2008. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Amelia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, body lotion, coffee, salt, Fanta, fish, oil, cigarettes and biscuits.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en: Esperanca is taking out a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as water, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, body lotion and cigarettes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because to be offered a loan for poor people will help to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy water, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and body lotion

loans.name: Juleta

texts.en:
Juleta is applying for a loan of $1000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house. Juleta is married and she has two children.
She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as soap, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, milk, soft drinks (Coca Cola, Fanta, Sagiko, Sprite) and hard drinks (beer). She is making good money from her sales and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.
 
Juleta is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to shop, including students. Her husband is driver. She is happy with this loan because the loan offered is for her to improve her living conditions for the future.

Juleta has animals like pigs, goats as an additional business.

loans.use: To buy soap, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, milk, soft drinks (Coca Cola, Fanta, Sagiko, Sprite) and hard drinks (beer).

loans.name: Mekika

texts.en: Mekika is a 33-year-old single woman with 2 children. She makes and sells cocoa, rice, taro, bread, fruit etc. in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Mekika needs a loan to buy sugar,rice,flour and big pans. She plans to use her profits to help help improve her family's standard of living. Mekika has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and big pans

loans.name: Susuga

texts.en: Susuga is a 53-year-old widow with 4 children. She makes and sells taro, cocoa, rice etc. in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Susuga needs a loan to buy sugar, flour, baking soda, rice, spoons and big pans. She plans to use her profits to extend her house. Susuga has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, baking soda, rice, spoons and big pans.

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en:
Now the Sari Indah group has 5 members. They have decided to take out another loan to increase their pig business. They are motivated by the other members who have already had success and they also hope they can be like them.

Ni Ayu has 2 adult children and her husband works as a farmer. The pig business has proven to support her family's income. Her husband helps her to maintain the pigs. This loan will be used to purchase feed and renovate the barn. She expects the sow will give birth again soon. She has plans to become a piglet seller. She dreams to have a nice kitchen and she hopes she can make this come true by running this business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and renovate the barn

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 30 years old and a mother of two school-aged children. She already has four years of experience raising pigs. According to her, this activity makes her assist her husband in supporting their daily expenditures and in financing the education of their children. Mary Ann shared that the most tiresome part of raising hogs is cleaning the pig pen every day. However, she is determined to work hard to improve her family's way of living. To earn even more income, Mary Ann wants to avail loan of 50,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to buy five additional piglets to raise and to buy a supply of feed for them. She dreams of seeing her business grow, thus she is really striving hard.

loans.use: to buy five additional piglets to raise and to buy a supply of feeds.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a mother of four, Liezel finds it hard to earn sufficient income to finance her family's daily needs, thus she decided to engage in a hog-raising business. Liezel has been managing the said activity for three years and she said she is just earning enough to help her husband, Henry, to finance their expenditures. 

At this time, Liezel is asking for a loan of Php 30,000 because she has insufficient capital to buy an additional hog to raise and stock of feed for her hogs. She would like to raise hogs continuously to save enough money for emergency purposes. Liezel is very positive that KIVA lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: to buy an additional hog to raise and stock of feeds for her hogs

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en: Juvita is taking out a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as sweet oranges and other fruits. She opened her business a year ago, with her own working capital of $200.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy sweet oranges and other fruits

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a farmer from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old and single with one child.
 
He earns a meager income from his farming activities, which he has been doing for five years. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer.
 
Ronald has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ronald hopes to own a coconut field someday.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a farmer from CPG, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of eight children. Celsa has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. She works with her husband in tilling and cultivating their lot.

Celsa is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting their yield and income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a farmer from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three children, ages 11, 9 and 8. Cherry has been in the farming business with her husband for more than four years now. 

Cherry is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for the labor cost. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. 

In the future, Cherry hopes to make her farming venture a success and a stable source of her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jaime no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Jaime trabaja brindando servicios de vigilancia en una empresa de su ciudad, adicionalmente cría y vende cuyes, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jaime se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar materiales para construir 2 jaulas nuevas para sus cuyes, ya que ahora cuenta con mas cantidad de cuyes y  necesita brindarles un mejor ambiente para su crianza, así pues Jaime seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Jaime, 28, lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with his wife and small son.  He is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who makes every effort to provide for his family.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of resources and the need to work, Jaime was unable to study for a law degree as he would have liked.

On his own initiative, Jaime works as a security guard at a company in the city.  He also raises and sells guinea pigs.  He works approximately ten hours a day and believes things are going well for him because of his dedication and hard work.

Jaime is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to build two new cages for his guinea pigs since he now has more animals and wants to give them the best surroundings possible.  This will allow Jaime to continue working toward his goal of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: To build two cages.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Felipa is borrowing 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Felipa has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Luís quien es comerciante y padre de sus 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 1 año de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de su hermana y su sobrino. Ana se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales y refrescos de diversos sabores. Para eso instala todos los días una mesa en el frontis de su casa  donde acomoda sus frutas y sus refrescos y los ofrece teniendo bastante acogida por su trato amable y el buen sabor de sus refrescos. Se inicios hace más de 02 años en este negocio, y hasta el momento los viene realizando ella sola, pero en ocasiones le apoya su hermana. Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea continuar con su negocio e incursionar en la venta de productos comestibles para eso quiere abrir una tienda en su casa. Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 300 nuevos soles, comprará frutas regionales para su negocio.
texts.en: Ana is 27 years old and is a hard working and diligent woman, with great desire to get ahead.  She is married to Luis who is a businessman and father of their three children ages 7, 5, and 1.  They live in a rented house along with Ana's sister and brother-in-law.  Ana works selling regional fruits and drinks of varied flavors.  For this reason she sets up a table in front of her home every day where she arranges her fruits and juices and offers them, getting rather good business due to her kind treatment and the good flavor of her drinks.  She began this business more than two years ago, and until now she has been doing everything alone, but on occasions her sister helps her.  For that reason, now seeing the good results that she is getting, she wants to continue with her business and begin selling food products and therefore she wants to open a store in her home.  This will be her fourth loan from Kiva and she is very thankful for the financial support she receives in order to get ahead.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time.  With the loan requested of 300 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency) she will buy regional fruits for her business.

loans.use: To buy regional fruits.

loans.name: Carmelia

texts.es:
Carmelia es de la ciudad de Santaní, esta estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad, comenta que quiere poder convertirse en una excelente profesional que sea de ayuda a las personas que necesitan de sus conocimientos. Quienes la inspiran a estudiar es su familia, ya que ellos han sido su mayor ejemplo.
Sus ganas de salir adelante es lo que la destaca de las demás personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases, ya que hay cuentas que tiene que cubrir para poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Carmelia is from the city of Santaní, and she is studying accounting.  She comments that she wants to be able to become an excellent professional who is of help to people who need her skills.  Her family inspires her to study, since they have been her best example.  She has a desire to get ahead which is what distinguishes her.

She is asking for a loan in order to pay for her classes.  She has bills that she must pay in order to continue studying.  She is thankful for the opportunity granted her and it will be of much help.

loans.use: To pay for University classes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, a 33-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. For nine years now she has been running a general store in the Philippines, and earns an additional income selling frozen goods.

Having borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF, Alma has requested a new one for PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Asociación El Comején Group

texts.es: “El Comité de Agua Potable “ASODECCOM”, se encuentra ubicado en el departamento de Masaya. El CAPS lleva operando por más de 7 años un pozo de agua comunitario, que abastece de agua potable a 710 familias de la comunidad rural del Comején No. 2, así como escuelas e iglesias de esta comunidad, que suman alrededor de más de 3,500 usuarios directos. Actualmente la comunidad está desabastecida de agua potable debido a que la bomba sumergible no está trabajando a su capacidad, teniendo los pobladores que viajar largas distancias para comprar agua mucho más cara en algunos puestos e incrementando el riesgo de contraer enfermedades.  El CAPS solicita un préstamo para compra e instalación de una nueva bomba y panel de control que permita la restitución del servicio de agua potable a la comunidad.
texts.en:
The Committee for Potable Water with ASODECCOM is located in the department of Masaya. The Committee has been operating a community well for more than seven years. It supplies the rural community of Comején No. 2 with potable water for 710 families, as well as the community's schools and churches, more than 3,500 users. The community is currently undersupplied, because the submersible pump isn't working to capacity. This means people in the community have to travel long distances to buy much more expensive water, with an increased risk of contracting illnesses. 

The Committee is seeking a loan for the purchase and installation of a new pump and control panel that will allow the restoration of potable water to the community.

loans.use: to purchase a new pump and control panel.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Epifania lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than seven years now.

Epifania is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages. She also wants to buy piglets to raise. With this loan, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Epifania hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im, a 49-year-old mother of six children. is a farmer who is assisted by her husband. She lives in a humble house in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province where the couple grows rice as their main crop to feed their children. However, their income is barely enough to cover their living costs, so some of her children go off to Phnom Penh from their village to work as garment workers to support the family financially.

Im wants to improve her rice production by applying fertilizer. She is therefore requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs. This will help her with her harvest and will significantly improve her income. With the additional earnings made possible by this loan, she will save to achieve her dream of having a big farm in years to come and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Antonia Eloina

texts.es:
Antonia, solamente estudio 2º grado de educación básica. Actualmente está acompañada y su compañero de vida le colabora en el negocio, los hijos tienen edades de 24, 27 y  30 años, pero solo el hijo menor está viviendo con ellos.

Administra una pequeña panadería, con 13 años de experiencia en la elaboración de pan francés y pan dulce, ya que heredó de su familia aprender a hacer tal oficio, es el único ingreso con que cuenta y junto a su hijo menor y compañero de vida lo sacan a flote.

 El fin del préstamo es para cambiar el techo que actualmente tiene el horno donde hace el pan; ya que está un poco deteriorado y puede producirle costos adicionales si se cae anticipadamente. Además, invertirá en la compra de latas para hornear y producir más.

La señora Antonia junto a su familia tienen muchos sueños y anhelos de ser una de las mejores panaderías de su sector y ganar terreno dentro del mercado, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación esperan lograrlo.
texts.en:
Antonia only studied up to the second grade of primary school. She is in a common-law marriage and her partner works with her in the business. Her children are 24, 27, and 30 years old, but only the youngest one lives with them.

She runs a small bakery and has 13 years of experience making French bread and sweet bread. She inherited this profession from her family, who taught her to bake. This is her only source of income. Along with her youngest son and her spouse, they keep the business afloat.

With this loan, she will change the roof over the oven where she bakes bread. This roof is deteriorating and could cause extra costs if it collapses unexpectedly. She will also invest in the purchase of baking tins to bake and produce more bread.

Antonia and her family have many dreams and they wish to have one of the greatest bakeries in the neighborhood, gaining market share. With plenty of effort and dedication, they hope they will achieve this goal.

loans.use: to change the roof over her oven, as it is deteriorating and can cause additional costs if it collapses, and to invest in the purchase of baking tins to bake and produce more bread.

loans.name: Caserio Chenihuitz Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca de estado civil casada, tiene 36 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria, tiene 6 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negocio desde muy pequeña con sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 25 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también se dedica a la agricultura.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para agricultura, como fertilizante, semillas entre otros, desea en el futuro tener más terreno para poder tener variedad de cosechas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Francisca, 36, is married and has a primary school education. She has six children, two of whom are studying. She works in agriculture. She started this business when she was very young alongside her parents, and she now has 25 years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who also works in agriculture.

She has decided to organize a group and apply for a loan. She will invest this loan in the purchase of farm supplies, such as fertilizer and seeds, among others. In the future, she wishes to have more land so that she can have a variety of crops. The other members of this group also work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Quisel

texts.en:
Filipinos have been "balut" (unhatched eggs)-lovers over the years. Hence, Quisel has this business opportunity to put up the balut-making process. 

There is a process before producing this product. Supplies of fresh eggs should be maintained, specifically from ducks' eggs. The eggs are incubated and will be harvested after 16 to 18 days, before they hatch in the incubator. The harvested balut will then be delivered to different balut retailers.

Quisel has been in this business for 20 years already. The business helps her in the support of her family. She had one dependent child who is in secondary level now.

The purpose of this loan is to buy ducks for producing eggs, since she can save by not having to buy fresh eggs from outside sellers who maintain their own ducks.  Therefore, the production of balut is stable, since she already has fresh eggs. The ducks are transported to the rice fields at the end of every harvest so that they can feed.  The eggs will be brought to where the incubator is located.

loans.use: to buy ducks for laying eggs for balut-making.

location.town: Dipolog - Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ernesto De Jesús

texts.es: Ernesto, a sus 66 años de edad, es casado y  padre de 4 hijos. Hace 12 años ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en compañía de su esposa, gracias a esto ha adquirido experiencia en el manejo y administración de varios tipos de negocio. Hace un año, decidió trasladarse de barrio y abrió una tienda de abarrotes en un espacio de la casa donde vive; allí ofrece productos lácteos, cárnicos, granos, mecato, gaseosas, galletería y otros productos de la canasta familiar; de esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos que se presentan en su hogar. El negocio ha tenido muy buena acogida en el barrio, ya que tiene gran variedad de productos para ofrecer a la clientela, además está ubicado en una calle muy reconocida del sector. El cliente es un hombre luchador y organizado, manifiesta que su edad no lo detiene para trabajar y sentirse útil, por el contrario, se motiva día a día para seguir luchando y hacer crecer su negocio. Es por ello, que solicita el apoyo del crédito, que será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor (granos, pastas, lácteos, huevos, productos de aseo, entre otros), de esta forma tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para la venta, lo que aumentará su clientela, sus ventas y por ende, sus ingresos; esto le ayudará a seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de abrir un minimercado, con el cual pueda ofrecer oportunidades de empleo, generar mayores ingresos y disfrutar de una estabilidad económica favorable y mejor calidad de vida al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 66 years old, married, and the father of four children. For 12 years he has worked as an independent businessman along with his wife, thanks to which he has experience in the management and administration of different types of businesses. A year ago, he decided to move to a different neighborhood, and opened a grocery store in a part of his home. In this store, he sells dairy products, meat products, grains, snacks, soft drinks, baked goods, and other basics. The business has been very well received in the neighborhood due to the large variety of products on offer, as well as its location on a well-known street.

Ernesto is a determined and organized man who shows that his age won't stop him from working or feeling useful; on the contrary, he motivates himself every day to persevere and grow his business. For this reason, he is requesting this loan, which will be used to purchase supplies wholesale (grains, pasta, dairy, eggs, cleaning products, and more) which will allow him to have a greater variety of products to sell, thus increasing his customer base, his sales, and as a result, his income. This will help Ernesto to continue moving forward and achieve his dream of opening a small market where he can offer employment opportunities, increase his income, and enjoy economic stability and a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (grains, pasta, dairy, eggs, cleaning products, among others.)

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
This is Husam's second loan cycle from Ryada. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and had a positive outcome, and he was able to marry; he also has one child. Today, Husam is planning to keep on developing his business to make sure that his child will have the best living and education and, at the same time, ensure that his customers are satisfied. 

He decided to take this loan to purchase a power generator and make new decorations.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator.

loans.name: Pricesitas Del Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRINCESITAS DEL AMOR”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos lácteos, venta de café, elaboración de artesanías, venta de comida, venta de frescos, venta de dulces, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudia es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chompas; este negocio lo emprendió porque conocía la técnica de tejido y fue un gran apoyo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito en grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Princesitas del Amor” (Little Princesses of Love) is in its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Claudia as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling dairy products, selling coffee, making handicrafts, selling food, selling soft drinks, selling sweets, and weaving blankets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Claudia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization. Claudia currently has a sewing business in which she makes sweaters. She started this business after she learned her knitting technique and now her business has been a great help.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then use the material to make the products she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Claudia is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Claudia said that she enjoys obtaining credit as a group.

loans.use: to buy wool for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es una persona muy sencilla y agradable, es de la ciudad de Ybycui, un bello departamento, con lindas riquezas naturales.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y comenta que se está esforzando al máximo por ser una buena profesional que sirva de ayuda a las demás personas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y también para poder pagar sus clases de la universidad, lo que le será de gran ayuda para seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Sara is modest and friendly.  She is from Ybycui, a beautiful department with rich natural resources.  She is studying for a degree in business administration and says that she is making every effort to be good professional that helps other people.  The loan she is requesting will enable her to pay her fees as well as her classes at the university, which will be a great help in continuing her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university classes and fees.

loans.name: Andrés Felipe

texts.es: Andrés es un joven que vive con su madre y su abuela. Hace algunos meses se dedica a laborar como operario en un taller de confecciones; actividad  que alterna con la venta de productos Amway, con el fin de generar ingresos adicionales para aportar económicamente a su hogar. El cliente es activo, dinámico, enérgico y se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas; esto lo motiva para solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (cremas corporales, shampoo, cremas faciales, suplementos vitamínicos, etc), de esta forma aprovechará los descuentos que obtiene por compras de contado, disminuyendo los costos de los artículos; lo que le permitirá aumentar su margen de utilidades, además tendrá más variedad de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que conlleva al incremento de las ventas y los ingresos; dándole la oportunidad de avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal deseo, que es estudiar una carrera profesional, que le ofrezca a mediano plazo la posibilidad de labrarse un futuro próspero y exitoso, para seguir ayudando a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Andrés is a young man who lives with his mother and grandmother. Some months ago he worked as a machinist in a clothing factory, which he alternated with his work selling Amway products so that he could earn an additional wage to financially support his household. He is active, dynamic, energetic and throws himself into achieving his goals. This is why he is asking for his first loan, in order to invest it in buying stock in bulk (body creams, shampoo, facial creams, vitamin supplements etc.). 

With this loan, he can take advantage of the discounts for paying in cash, reducing the cost of the products, which will allow him to increase his profit margins, and also to have a wider variety of merchandise to offer his customers, which will bring increased sales and income. This will then give him the opportunity to advance towards achieving his biggest wish, which is to study for a professional career, which offers him the possibility in the medium-term to build a prosperous and successful future for himself, and so continue to help his family and improve the living conditions in his home.

loans.use: to buy stock in bulk (body creams, shampoo, facial creams, vitamin supplements etc.)

loans.name: Sandra Marilu

texts.es:
Sandra, vive actualmente con sus dos hijas. Ella, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pupusas, asimismo antojitos, actividad que la desempeña desde hace dos años y medio, lo realiza todos los días por las tardes, ya que es un negocio con el cual obtiene excelentes resultados.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la materia prima, tales como: quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, condimentos, entre otros y también para comprar ropa. Esta inversión le ayudara  a mejorar su negocio y para ofrecerles un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Sandra lives with her two daughters. She makes and sells pupusas (traditional Salvadorian food) as well as snacks. She has done this for the past two and a half years, every day in the afternoon, with excellent results. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as cheese, pork cracklings, cabbage, spices etc, plus buy some clothes. This investment will help her improve her business and offer better service to her customers. Her dream is to expand her business and provide a higher standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork cracklings, cabbage, spices etc. and also to buy clothes.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

Corazon has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut milk. Corazon is borrowing 9,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, noodles, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 66 years old and married.

Barbara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, candies, snack foods, shampoo and other groceries in her general store.

Barbara has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap.

Barbara aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, candies, snack foods, shampoo and other groceries in her general store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 59 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs an accessories business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of accessories to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of accessories to sell

loans.name: Naila's Group

texts.en:
Naila is a member of a two-person lending group, and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has been running a clothing business for the past many years. She purchase clothes from different areas of Pakistan and sells them in the main market at a profitable price. The income generated from her clothing business plays a very important role for the family's needs.

Presently, she needs to purchase a variety of clothes to sell in the market. She does not have enough savings to purchase them. So, she has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. She dreams to provide all the facilities to her children. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su familia. Ella, posee una tienda de productos de uso domestico. El prestamo que solicita le permitira comprar mercaderia, tales como: frijoles, azucar, arroz, sal, jabón, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener mayor utilidad en el negocio y adquirir más mercadería para aumentar sus productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es obtener mayor rendimiento en el negocio y  adquirir bienes para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her family. She has a store with home products. The loan she is seeking will allow her to buy merchandise, such as: beans, sugar, rice, salt and soap, among others. This investment will help her to have better utility in her business and acquire more merchandise to increase her products.

Her previous loan helped her to provide better service to her customers. Her dream is to obtain better performance from the business and acquire goods to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, salt and soap, among others.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is married with 3 children. She is 46 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines.

To earn a living, Ruby has a "suman" (a rice cake which is a native delicacy) business. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns approximately 6,000 PHP. Ruby has been a member of PMPC for 8 years and has constantly reached to PMPC for the financial needs of her business. Now, she is applying for another loan to buy more bags of glutinous rice and more kilos of sugar and other ingredients.

In the future, Ruby hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of glutinous rice and sugar for her suman business

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, cuenta con 39 años de edad, casada, no tiene hijos y su esposo se trabaja como agente de seguridad personal.

Por su parte ella, se dedica a la panadería desde hace 12 años, aprendió este trabajo con su hermana horneando en una cocina pequeña con horno, hacían pan para el consumo de la casa. 

Luego, decidieron elaborar pan, ya no solo para consumo familiar, sino para los habitantes de la misma comunidad y generar ingresos a su familia. Ahora, la producción de pan ha aumentado progresivamente y tiene personas de la misma comunidad trabajando en la panadería. 

El  crédito será destinado a la compra de harinas, azúcar, levadura, huevos, entre otros insumos para la elaboración del pan. Que es el sustento diario de muchas personas que madrugan para irse a trabajar temprano.

De esta manera se espera incrementar la producción y sus ingresos para pagar el crédito y solventar sus necesidades económicas.

Alba piensa en recuperar su inversión lo más pronto posible, para solventar la deuda del crédito y luego, de ser necesario sacar otro crédito para mejorar las  instalaciones  de su panadería. Además las condiciones de vida para su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Alba is a hardworking and responsible individual. She is 39 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband works as a security staff person.

Alba has been managing a bakery for 12 years. She learned this type of work when she and her sister used a small oven for baking. They made bread for household consumption. Later on, Alba decided to make bread for the residents of her community in addition to her own family so that she could generate income. Now her bread production has increased steadily and she has employees who live in the same community and work in the bakery.

Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, and other supplies for making bread. This enables her to provide daily sustenance for many people who must get up early in order to leave for work. Alba hopes to increase her production and use the profits to repay the loan and cover her financial needs. She plans to recoup her investment as quickly as possible so that she can settle this debt. Later on, she would like to obtain another loan so that she can improve the facilities within her bakery as well as the living conditions for her small family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, and other supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, shampoo, eggs, noodles, etc., for her general store business.  Rebecca has been in this business for 3 years. Rebecca earns more income from food vending and raising pigs.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, shampoo, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sumera's Group

texts.en:
Sumera is a member of a two-person lending group and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hardworking housewife. Her husband has excellent electrician skills. He is an honest and loyal person and he always fulfills his duties with full dedication and honesty. He owns an electronic shop where he provides electronic services and sells electric motors.  He purchases damaged motors, binds them with new copper wires, paints them and resells them in the market.

Presently he needs to purchase cable coils for binding. He does not have enough savings to purchase them, so his wife, Sumera, has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. She dreams to provide all the facilities for her children. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase cable coils for binding

loans.name: Nelson De Jesús

texts.es: Nelson, a sus 27 años de edad, es casado y aún no tiene hijos. Es un campesino que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, gracias a la tradición y enseñanzas de su padre. Actualmente cuenta con cultivos de café, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en la plaza de mercado del pueblo donde reside; de esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.  El cliente es un hombre pujante, trabajador, apasionado por su labor y, a pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentan debido a la falta de capital para abonar sus cultivos, siempre busca la manera de salir adelante. Es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo de su primer ciclo de crédito, con el cual desea comprar insumos agrícolas (abonos, fungicidas, pesticidas, fertilizantes), con el fin de seguir cuidando sus cultivos y abonarlos, pues ya se acerca la temporada de cosecha, lo que le ayudará para que sea más productiva y sacar un producto de muy buena calidad para venderlo a mejor precio en el mercado, de esta forma aumentará sus ganancias y tendrá la capacidad de seguir solventando los gastos de su hogar, además de pagar la nómina de los jornaleros que le colaboran en el abono y recolección de la cosecha. Nelson sueña con ampliar y fortalecer su negocio, pues es su principal fuente de ingresos, con la que podrá sacar adelante a su familia, brindándole mejores condiciones de vida y un futuro más prometedor y existoso.
texts.en:
Nelson is 27 years old. He is married but does not yet have any children. He is a farmer, who from a very young age has worked in agriculture, thanks to the traditions and teachings of his father. Currently he grows coffee beans, which are harvested and sold in the market place of the town where he lives. This way, he earns enough money to cover his household expenses. 

He is a thriving and hard-working man who is passionate about his work, and despite the obstacles he faces due to his lack of capital to fertilize his crops, he always looks for a way to move forward. This is why he is asking for the support of his first loan, which he wants to use to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, fungicides, pesticides, and fertilizers, in order to continue looking after his crops and fertilize them, since harvest season is approaching. This will help his crops produce more and yield a high quality product that he can sell at a higher price at the market. This will mean his income will increase and he will be able to continue paying his household bills as well as the day labourers that he works with for the fertilizing and harvesting of the crops.

Nelson dreams of expanding and strengthening his business, as it is his main source of income, with which he will be able to help his family move forward, with better living conditions and a future that is more promising and successful.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, fungicides, pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es un joven con muchos ideales y sueños que quiere cumplir. Está estudiando análisis de sistemas, y comenta que su sueño es poder ser un gran profesional útil a las demás personas.
Estudiar en estos 4 años y luego salir y ser independiente, trabajar con muchas empresas, tomar experiencia y luego formar una familia, esas son las expectativas que tiene Angel.
El solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad,  y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en:
Angel is from the city of San Ignacio. He is a young man who has many ideals and dreams that he would like to fulfill. Angel is studying Systems Analysis and says that his dream is to become a successful professional who will be useful to other people.

Angel is in his fourth year of study and would like to go on to become independent. He also wants to work for many companies, gain experience, and later start a family. These are all the things he expects to accomplish.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the payment of his university fees. This will help him to get one step closer to his dream.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta is married and has three children. She is 33 years old and resides in Camanga, Tukuran, Philippines. Mercideta owns farm land and cultivates rice for a living. Her husband is a government employee serving in the BJMP department. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 25,000 PHP doing this type of business.

Mercideta requested a loan of 43,000 PHP to finance weeding costs and fertilizer. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Mercideta wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to finance weeding costs and fertilizer

loans.name: Naghma

texts.en:
Naghma has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's Partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is doing a job at the airport as a maintenance man; he is responsible for the maintenance of all the wooden doors, windows, tables and chairs. His income is insufficient to meet the daily family expenditures. Therefore, he wants to start a small carpentry shop to generate a good amount of income. He wants to start this business as part-time work. This would help Naghma to increase her net income and savings.

Naghma has requested a loan to help her husband. He would purchase wood and other needful products for manufacturing wooden tables, beds and cupboards to sell. 

Naghma hopes that the loan amount will be helpful for her husband. She would save the profit amount for future needs. She thanks all Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan staff for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other needful products for manufacturing wooden tables, beds and cupboards to sell.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres y hermanos, el se dedica a la agricultura  especialmente a la siembra de cebolla, maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, sus hermanos le ayudan en la siembra, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cera de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a su familia en los gastos del hogar, francisco esta solicitado un crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. para continuar con sus siembras  y así obtener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Francisco is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his parents and siblings. He is a farmer who has specialized in growing onions, corn, and beans for several years. His siblings help him with the planting and also with selling the products at the markets near his home. With the profit he earns from his sales, Francisco is able to help his family with the household expenses.

Francisco is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can continue maintaining his crops in order to generate more income and to continue helping his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Aileen is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials and equipment for her fishing business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past seventeen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a mother of four sons and one daughter. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. Her eldest son is married and responsible for all household expenses. He owns a small clothing shop. He sells bed sheets, blankets, pillow covers, etc. in the shop. He does not have any other source of income. This is a sucessful business for his family and the income generated from his work plays a very important role in meeting the family's needs. 

Presently, he needs finances to purchase bed sheets, pillow covers and blankets to sell. Therefore, Khursheed has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to purchase the material for the shop. 

Her son wants to use the profit amount to save for the family's future needs. Khursheed is feeling happy and relaxed after taking this loan.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets, pillow covers and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz, con tan sólo 19 años de edad, ya vive en unión libre con su pareja. Luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios y al cumplir la mayoría de edad, le fue fácil conseguir empleo en el área comercial, gracias a su actitud creativa y espíritu emprendedor. Actualmente trabaja como asesora de telemercadeo en una empresa de call center. Pero con la necesidad de generar ingresos adicionales, encontró la oportunidad de montar su propio negocio de alquiler de video juegos por horas, aprovechando que en el sector donde reside no existía este tipo de comercio. Luz es muy activa, enérgica y trabajadora, pero ha tenido algunas dificultades con su negocio, pues éste sólo lo puede abrir a partir de las 5:00 pm, hora en la que culmina su jornada laboral en la empresa, generando un vacío que puede aprovechar otra persona para montar la competencia. Sin embargo, esto no la detiene, por el contrario se anima a seguir luchando para salir adelante. Por esta razón solicita su primer ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (televisor y un play station) para acreditar aún más su negocio y poder suplir la demanda actual que posee, pues los clientes algunos días deben hacer fila para poder acceder al servicio. Esto le ayudará a avanzar para cumplir el sueño de independizarse completamente, pues espera que su negocio le genere los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y poder disfrutar de un futuro prometedor a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Luz, who is only 19 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. After finishing her secondary education and turning 18, it was easy for her to find employment in the business sector, thanks to her creative attitude and entrepreneurial spirit. Currently she works as a telemarketing consultant at a call centre company. But with the need to earn an additional income, she found the opportunity to start her own business renting video games by the hour, as in the area where she lives there is no other business like it.

Luz is very active, energetic and hard-working, but she has had some difficulties with her business, as she can only open from 5 pm, when she finishes work at the call centre, leaving a gap that someone else could fill and create competition. However, this has not stopped her - on the contrary, she has decided to keep on fighting to get ahead. This is why she is asking for her first loan, with which she intends to buy fixed assets (a television and PlayStation) in order to consolidate her business and to be able to fulfil the current demand that is there, as some days clients have to queue in order to access the service.

This will help her get closer to achieving her dream of becoming completely independent, as she expects her business to generate enough income to help her husband with the household expenses and so be able to enjoy a promising future in the medium-term.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 65 years old, is married, and has two adult children.

Caridad owns and operates a business making and selling food and preparing and selling banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.
 
Aside from selling banana cue, she also has a "sari sari store", selling home use products to earn an extra income. She successfully repaid her previous loans that added capital for her banana cue business, and used its generated revenue to buy working inventory capital for her store.

Caridad is requesting another loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods and noodles for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and noodles for sale.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Fe is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus increasing her yield and profit. 

Fe hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the labor cost for the farm.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys does farming in one of Nairobi's environs, where she plants vegetables for sale. These include cabbages and spinach as well as tomatoes and onions. She is 24 years old and married with three children. She has been in this business for three years, and it has been profitable, making a monthly income of 9,000 Kenya Shillings.

This is her first loan term, and she plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds for planting. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow more varieties of vegetables and thereby make more income, and buy a plot of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jenny Judith

texts.es: Jenny, habita en un barrio populoso de Managua, propiedad de su mama, es madre soltera de una hija menor de edad que estudia la escuela primaria, Jenny se dedica a trabajar en su pequeña pulpería vendiendo productos básicos en donde también hace tortillas y las vende. Su mayor deseo es poder terminar de construir su propia casa, la cual no ha podido por sus limitaciones económicas, es por eso el motivo de este crédito solicitado para comprar materiales y continuar la obra, así poder trasladarse a su vivienda junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Jenny lives in a populous neighborhood of Managua in a property owned by her mother. She is a single mother of a young daughter who is attending primary school. Jenny works in a small store where she sells basic products. She also makes and sells tortillas.

Her greatest wish is to finish the construction of her own house since she is not able to do so because of financial limitations. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy materials for continuing the work so that she and her daughter can move into their own home.

loans.use: to buy materials for resuming the construction of her house.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para su mejorar su vivienda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar madera y laminas para la reparación de su casa.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a comprar los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz. Su deseo es brindarle aun mas   una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is applying for another loan because he requires more working capital for his home improvement projects. This money will help him to purchase lumber and laminate to make repairs to his home. 

His previous loan helped him purchase agricultural products for planting corn. He hopes to provide an even better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: purchase lumber and laminate.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer, age 55, is a housewife. She is a mother of one daughter and six sons. She belongs to a very poor family. Her husband is a wallet maker. He stitches wallets and sells them in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. His income is too low to fulfill even the very basic needs of his family. They are passing their life with so many financial issues as it is very difficult to survive these days with a small income. 

Anwer has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase rexine (artificial leather), zips and threads to stitch wallets and sell them in the main market. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Anwer hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's work. She hopes that one day she will be able to save enough money to provide education for her children. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase rexine, zips and threads to stitch wallets

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en:
Talosaga is 60 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as meats and daily products needed. She has been doing this for three years. 

Talosaga needs a loan to buy a deep freezer, a box of chicken, cigarettes, noodles, crates, Vailima beer, ice cream, sugar and flour. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business and help support her family’s daily needs and wants. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, a box of chicken, cigarettes, noodles, crates, Vailima beer, ice cream, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Veleros Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VELEROS”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rufina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de plásticos, venta de cordero, floristas, lechería, servicio de amplificación, venta de queso y carne de oveja, costura de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rufina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de flores; este negocio lo emprendió hace años porque le ayudaba a su madre en su negocio; cuando saca su primer préstamo se independiza y realiza su negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de flores) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Veleros” is starting its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Rufina as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling plastics, selling lambs, selling flowers, operating a dairy, providing sound services, selling cheese and lamb meat, and producing jackets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Rufina. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization. Rufina currently has a business of selling flowers. She started this business years ago because she was already helping her mother with her business. When she received her first loan, Rufina became independent and established her own business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying flowers, which she acquires from the wholesale vendors. She then sells her products from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income so that she can support her family. Rufina is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rufina said that she enjoys working as part of a group.

loans.use: to buy flowers to sell.

loans.name: Hildergard

texts.en:
Hildergard is 55 years old and widowed with four children. She runs a small business selling ice-cake in her community, and has been doing this for two years. 

Hildergard has requested a loan to buy a deep freezer, sugar, cordials, foam cups and milk. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Hildergard will use her earnings to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, sugar, cordials, foam cups and milk.

loans.name: Olinda Maribel

texts.es:
Olinda es una mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Olinda no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Olinda trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Olinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, así pues Olinda seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su minimarket.
texts.en:
